Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, well priced and excellent customer service. A gem in the heart of Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Dan U
Reviews.Content: I'm originally from Sydney, now living in Los Angeles. I haven't been home in some time but recently made the trip down under for my brother's surprise 40th birtday party. I decided to book a week at the Diamant Hotel in Potts Point primarily for the location - it really doesn't get much better - close to the city, Paddington & Darlinghurst, a short walk to the harbor foreshore (Rushcutters Bay) and 2 mins from Kings Cross train station and major bus routes. I actually used to live in Potts Point so am familiar with everything that part of town has to offer - aside from its central location, Potts Point (and neighboring Darlinghurst) has an army of cute coffee shops, restaurants, bars and shops.. a great place to base yourself in Sydney.. and that's coming from a local. So for roughly $200 a night, including a balcony/terrace I figured 'how bad could it be'. Well let me tell you, it wasn't bad at all, in fact it was downright GREAT! The Diamant Hotels boast a 'luxury boutique' hotel experience and that's pretty much what you get. The rooms are clean, modern and well sized. They include all the necessary ammenities - VERY COMFY BED, bath, shower, FREE internet and cable TV (these are the musts for me at least). The balcony is more a like a patio (huge) replete with outdoor furniture and most days I found myself sitting out there enjoying beautiful Sydney 'end of summer' weather. Not all the rooms have an outdoor area, but if you're willing to spend a bit extra its well worth it. The staff were super friendly and very accomodating. I can honestly say I enjoyed my stay there and will be on the look out for other Diamant Hotels (and other 8 Hotels for that matter) in my future travels. Look, if you want to be a typical tourist and spend fortunes on some generic big brand name hotels (Hyatt, Hilton) downtown then go for it, but if you want a more authentic Sydney experience, staying at a very cool, very hip and amazingly located hotel then look no further then the Diamant Hotel Potts Point.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very nice, good location but ....”
Reviews.Author: taftaf
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights and can not give more than 2 stars first because of the price, when you charged more than 180 $ , you expected more The safe didnt work, the TV didnt work , i asked 2 times ti get shower gel etc.. You have to pay for internet They provide a very bad service for laundry and expansive. I did complain many times about my jacket and every times i have to explain my case receptionist who did not get any information about an unhappy client. ( my jacket was fixed and sent to me to Melbourne) for this i gave them 2 stars and not one .

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient place to be”
Reviews.Author: linette d
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated at the top of William Street and Kings Cross in the throbbing heart of Sydney's entertainment and nightlife area. Also 3 minutes from the Hop-on Hop-Off bus and the Metro, which is very convenient. Quality/price is good and the rooms are clean and nice. A good place to stay when you are visiting Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for fun and friendliness”
Reviews.Author: allancsn
Reviews.Content: Stay for 8 days and loved every minute Fitness First passes were a great bonus we left fitter than when we arrived The dsk staff were great and were always friendly and helpful even with our weirder requests The local area was great for us with just the cosmopolitan atmosphere we love We would go back in a flash

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear, oh dear - badly needs a refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: ryanpa_UK
Reviews.Content: It's never a good sign when you have to wait 15 minutes for someone to arrive on reception to check you in and so our experience of the Diamant hotel started. We selected the hotel mainly based on the location as many of our friends live in the Potts Point area and the location is probably the only redeeming factor about this hotel. The first room we checked into smelt of mould and had a view of a brick wall so we asked to be moved. Thankfully the new room didn't smell and had some natural sunlight coming in. The hallways smelt really bad and you could tell they'd tried to cover the smell up by spraying lots of air freshener. It didn't work. As you can see by the photos that I've uploaded, the hotel is badly in need of a refurbishment - the curtains were coming off the rails, the shower was mouldy and the TV looked like it was fitted by amateurs. Worst of all the smoke detector was missing - in it's place was just the bracket where the smoke detector should have been attached. So, if you want a good location in Sydney but don't mind bad service, small smelly rooms or have any concerns about smoke/fire hazards then this probably the hotel for you!! If you check out my other reviews you will see I tend to give fair and balanced reviews - if a hotel is great I will say so but if it's bad then I will also say so!!! In other words, until this hotel has had a complete refurb, avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: TroyA1991
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Diamant Hotel for the weekend (Feb 18th/19th) with some friends to celebrated my 21st birthday. Out of all the Hotels in the Kings Cross and Darlinghurst district, I am so glad we choose this hotel. From making our reservation thru to check out Ashley was always of great assistance. Ashley gave us 2 fantastic rooms (401 & 402) with amazing views of the city (as requested), gave us a late check out of 12:00pm, sugested some great restaurants and even sent a letter to wish me a Happy 21st (nice personal touch!). Nothing seemed too small when we asked Ashley. Thank you!! Pro's: - Fantastic location. - Friendly, helpful staff. - Very modern decor! - Amazing beds. Con's: - None!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: Caltom67
Reviews.Content: Room was a bit dark but not nearly as dark as other reviews indicated, WiFi was almost un-usable so slow I could not even check my email. Room was overall very clean furniture and fixture are worn and probably should be refreshed soon. Staff was GREAT! So helpful! There was small issue with my reservation as I booked it twice one with money that I cancelled and rebooked with miles the clerk checked me in and had the problem solved before I was even up to my room. Concierge was very helpful stayed on hold forever to book things for me. What a great find in in a Sydney Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 starHas potential”
Reviews.Author: DoC11111
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately our stay at the Diamont was not as we had expected after looking at the website. Firstly, the reception area, foyer was less than inviting, dark dull and dreary. Secondly,there was a terrible smell in the hallway as we made our way to our room, Next, The rooms though spacious need some finishing touches to be a 4 star hotel. The furniture is old and stained and you feel as if you are occupying someones home while they are away. Then, it took a couple of hours after we moved in to get the TV working, then we were told that the movie options were not working. During the night as my wife went to the bathroom she was confronted by a couple of cockroaches which then left us unsettled for the rest of the night. I was disappointed to find out in the morning that there was no breakfast available in the hotel. Overall, there is potential, the location is great but in its current state I don't think it will get by business again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marcussss
Reviews.Content: Great location, staff friendly. Rooms are very fresh and clean. Will come back again. Great sleep at night compare to other hotel i stay at Kingcross area.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, no value for money”
Reviews.Author: BAHMelbourne
Reviews.Content: This place is expensive for unfriendly service you receive. Breakfast is at one of two cafes close by and these were awful! Staff are rude, broken glass on the patio ground outside, quilt dirty and only sheets, no Doona cover. I won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Well positioned hotel with professional and accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: Aaron_from_Canberra
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well positioned to take full advantage of the Darlinghurst, Potts Point and the Kings Cross offerings whilst at the same time very quiet within the room. â€¢ Public transport (rail/ city bus) access is at most a five minute walk away but often closer. â€¢ Bed and bedding within the room is particularly comfortable. â€¢ All staff encountered were friendly and accommodating to my requests. â€¢ In room entertainment is a little better than standard for a hotel at this level. â€¢ The in room Wi-Fi is a slow though I am advised that the hotel is addressing this. I did identify an issue in the room that reflects more upon a previous guest than the hotel but once brought to the attention of the front desk team it was handled quickly, efficiently and to my satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: ceneri
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for seven nights. The rooms were very comfortable and modern, and the desk staff was exceedingly helpful. Access to FitnessFirst was a plus as well. Proximity to the shops and restaurants on Victoria St. was useful. The hotel definitely caters to a young and fashionable clientele more than families.

Reviews.Title: “Slick safe haven amid the glittering hub-bub of Darlo & The Cross”
Reviews.Author: MissDebonair
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 great nights. Loved the theatrical curtains across the big glass windows, loved the dark retro Hollywood glam feel of the rooms, and was delighted with the iPod docking station, and the location. Delish bakery diagonally across the road in Darlo, and proximity to numerous interesting Thai, Japanese, Moroccan, Italian or even Eastern European hole in the wall eateries. You can catch the train to wherever you need to go from the Kings cross train station around the corner, and then reconnecting at Central or Town Hall or whatever. Nice reception and entrance area. The big prize here though goes to the concierge - when I left I needed to cart all my big black bags down the slightly steep road to the seedy strip to hail a cab, or so I thought, but in fact a very charming and professional concierge happily volunteered to help me, and made me feel like it was no trouble at all. He was really respectful and in all my 14 years of business travel this was one of the shining moments for me as a female business traveller: for once I felt like it was all OK: gender, class, status etcetera are not an issue here, and I really appreciated that. Will happily stay here again. They've got it going on!

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: Cass H
Reviews.Content: Well this hotel is in a fantastic location! There's not much else to say! The staff are friendly and helpful when asked. But.... We had trouble with our TV on arrival (and yes we are technology wise).. This problem continued though out our stay of 5 nights. Not that we wanted to sit in front of the idiot box all day/night, but you do expect to be able to flick through the channels on occasion! So after a 4 hr flight my partner required a beverage, maybe a diet coke... I Could not even accommodate this need, as there was not a bottle opener to be found. So back to the TV ...Upon trying to fix this problem on a number of occasions I asked for an iPod dock (which might I add was meant to be in our room) only to find this also had a malfunction.. It didn't work! So next option was a cup of tea.. Sounds great yeah, well not really as I couldn't stir my tea. yes that's right no spoons! This is my first post on trip advisor, and I have travelled quiet a bit, stayed in some great hotels... and some much, much worse venues..... But bang for buck, this is a three star. Might I add no breakfast room service, and the only room service is a limited menu between 5-10pm.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, nice rooms, quiet despite boisterous location”
Reviews.Author: TeamBroBra_Intl
Reviews.Content: The staff let us check in at 10am after a 22 hour flight from NYC, which was HUGE for us. We recharged by taking a nap and nipped our jetlag in the bud right away. The rooms are rather large, modern, updated. The hotel is adjacent to the 'main strip' in King's Cross, which is quite crazy; despite the hotel's proximity to the clubs and bars here, it was rather quiet. In retrospect, I would have stayed in The Rocks neighborhood since we ended up spending most of our time here, but the Diamant's location is good as a homebase to explore diverse areas of the city.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and fun neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: The King's Cross neighborhood was great. We could walk to downtown or take a quick bus ride to the beach. Tons of cool shops. The hotel was just as pictured and we were surprised how big the room was compared to many overseas hotels we have stayed in. It was clean and modern, and the bed was very comfortable, but most of all, the staff shined. Especially Adrian and Amanda. They helped us several times and did not steer us wrong went it came to recommending a place to eat or the best way to get around town. I would absolutely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend anyone to stay at the Diamant. Great staff and location. My only critism is that parking can be a little tricky, with only a limited number of spots available at the hotel, you can park at the nearby Kings Cross parking station but it is about a 10 minute walk, and in the rain with a suitcase, it is not fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Night Out with the Girls!”
Reviews.Author: Monte1972
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. Rooms clean, beds comfortable (had a great sleep in) late check out. Accommodating / friendly/ happy staff. Conveniently located to Kings X station, darlinghurst etc. Well priced. Thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Three nights in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: chrisnavi
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently we took the train from the airport, switched at the central station and stopped off at Kings Cross. The hotel was easy to find, and right around the corner from Kings Cross. We arrived a bit early around 11.30 and as expected our room was not ready. We had however planned for this and asked the staff to store our bags which they very professionally took care of with bagtags and all. We were nicely asked to come back around 15, and decided to spend some time in the city. When coming back our room still was not ready, so we were given another one at level 5. Room 517 to be exact. The feeling when we entered the room was "wow". The materials were modern, it smelled freshly and the bathroom was inviting and spacious, with nice shampoos and soaps and whatnot. The room had a large lcd placed on the wall, and also a well-sized safe, an ipod dock and some other standard amenities. The minibar was however automatic and we quickly found out that all spirits were missing. This was apparently some kind of mistake, and was corrected by the staff downstairs. The room was very quiet and our kingsize bed was super comfy. During the mrs. first shower she noticed some small mold-like stains on the shower wall. The next day we carefully notified the staff, which stated that they were sorry and would take care of it. This was not done when we returned later that day - and this was basically the only let down of our stay. It should also be stated that the internet connection in both the lobby and the room was nothing but terrible. So insanely slow. I can't believe this great hotel doesn't have a quicker connection! Either way I would recommend it to anyone, as it is very nicely situated, nicely priced and professionally managed and maintained. I would not mind coming back for a second visit. I would however go for a bigger room, just for the fun of it :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anika71
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 wk for business here last Nov '10 and was more than happy! It's centrally located; quaint restaurants, coffee shops, bakery, breakfast spots on the left from cross corner. Bars, louder restaurants and stripjoints and convenient shops on the right. Walk past that to get to trendier restaurants and shops. Also in same direction is train, jump on that to get to the CBD and walk to Opera House, The Rocks, etc. Hotel was super clean and though on Fri nites the right side of the cross is crazy, not a peep to my 8th floor room. Wifi is only in the tiny lobby, but usually pretty quiet and valid for 1day at a time. The front desk and door/concierge were beyond helpful and polite. Bed, linens, shower, everything was top notch and comfy. After business flew to Queensland and was able to store my luggage free; though decided to come back for my last 2 days on my own to stay again. On the pricey side, but well worth the comfort, ease and sense of security. Would go back again on my own in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnitaH4300
Reviews.Content: This is a solid 3 1/2 star hotel. I would have given it 4 stars if the toilet seat hadn't fallen off, if it wasn't so dusty and an extra bar of soap would have been nice. They did give the toilet seat immediate attention though. The reception staff were excellent, very friendly and attentive. They answered all our questions and gave us suggestions on breakfast and about trains to a wedding we were attending and even remembered the ask how the wedding was the next morning when we checked out. We loved the idea of checking out at 11am as opposed to 10am because we didn't wake up until 9.45am :) Having magazines and the daily paper available to take in the reception area is brilliant. The flat screen and foxtel was a bonus. The shower had excellent pressure but there isn't a door so it sprays out a bit. And there is nothing better than crisp white linen instead of dirty old bedspreads. The hotel is in an excellent area, right by Kings Cross. The train station is just across the road to take you to the rest of Sydney. We felt very safe in the area and had no problems on the train or through Kings Cross at 1am in the morning. There's an adorable little market at one end of Kings Cross on Saturday morning. At night we didn't have any trouble sleeping with it being on such a busy street. Overall, I will definitely stay here again and can't wait to come back and try more of the great wog food at the markets!!

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: AnnevdH
Reviews.Content: My sis and I stayed at the Diamant for 4 days. The rooms are spotlessly clean, beds comfortable, nice toiletries and great water pressure. Off site breakfast is also a treat - I recommend the omelettes. Free wifi for 1 hour in the lobby, no business suite available.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to end our Australia trip”
Reviews.Author: Claire H
Reviews.Content: Our room was upgraded when we checked in, which was a good start! We stayed here for 5 nights in a deluxe room and were impressed with the room and the hotel in general. Thanks to Amanda on reception for her excellent food recommendations! One warning - don't touch anything in the mini bar unless you plan to eat it - the system is extremely sensitive!

Reviews.Title: “Free Internet!”
Reviews.Author: Dixie_Hollins
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Diamant Hotel Sydney. Excellent choice! The hotel offers free internet service in the rooms. The location is outstanding for entertainment purposes as the hotel is located around the corner from Sydney's King's Crossing entertainment district. Like many Australian hotels instead of a bar of soap the bathroom amenties are liquid shampoo, conditioner and body soap provieded in liquid medium by wall mounted dispensers. If you need a bar of soap, bring your own. The room was large and decorated in a contemporary style. Even numbered rooms have a view of the Harbor Bridge and downtown Sydney! Front desk staff assisted with downloading documents, scanning and faxing documents for no charge. There are any number of restaurants outside the door including a Coles Supermarket open until 1200 Midnight. The hotel offers COMP Gym facilities at the asdjacent Copmmerical Gym! Free room safes complete the offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service!”
Reviews.Author: Bas_8
Reviews.Content: We didn't like the hotel, especially because we experienced problems with our booking which we found weren't handled properly. The rooms were OK but small. The location was good and convenient for walking into the city. We have now stayed in two different hotels of the group and won't come back on our next trip to Sydney. They ask too much money for what you actually get.

Reviews.Title: “Good value place to spend Christmas overseas”
Reviews.Author: SingaporeRedDot
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at how much Sydney hotels were charging over the Christmas/NYE period especially with the terrible GBP exchange rate. However, I think the Diamant Hotel was a good find for the price over Christmas. The hotel was stylishly appointed, with a swish lobby (free wifi here) with a coffee stand in it. The corridors and rooms were fairly dark - suppose this is meant to imply 'sexiness'. We had a basic room which was fairly large including a massive bed. Everything felt new and modern. We asked for the minibar to be emptied so we could stash all our own Christmas drinks in it and they swiftly obliged. Polite and friendly staff also made the stay very pleasant. I've never stayed in hotel over Christmas before and there wasn't much of a Christmas vibe but then I didn't really expect it there to be. The atmosphere in the hotel was low-key and relaxing which is exactly what I wanted. There any amenities as such, there's no restaurant or lobby bar or gym or pool or anything at all really but for the price that was fine. You are surround by bars and restaurants and cheap cafes for breakfast and I think you could get a day pass for the gym next door should you wish. Don't be fooled by Potts Point mentioned in the address as it's right in the middle of Kings Cross. Kings Cross can feel a bit grubby and scary but was close to bars, restaurants, supermarket and public transport so I was actually pretty happy in this area. Walking away from King Cross towards Darlinghurst Rd there are cool bars and restaurants like Darlo Bar. You can also wander anywhere from here really if you are up to it - Hyde Park is about 10 min stroll away, CBD/Shopping 15 mins, Royal Botanical Gardens 15 or so mins, Darling Harbour 25 mins etc. Despite the decent public transport in the area we walked most places. Overall, if you are looking for a basic but very stylish hotel to act as a base for your city trip then this hotel is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, love the decor! Would definitely stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Ez H
Reviews.Content: My friend and her boyfriend booked a Courtyard Room for her birthday for the weekend. Myself and another friend spent the evening in the hotel with them. The room was great, the decor was very modern and funky, I like the 'darkness' that everyone seems to be complaining about - it's just the colour scheme! Plenty of light when you switch the lights on! Great spot - right in the heart of all of The Cross nightclubs and cafes. Private balcony was great for pre-drinks and awesome view of Sydney city. I would definitely book to stay here myself. The only issue was parking, my friends who booked had to park several streets away.

Reviews.Title: “BYO flashlight or you'll spend the night in the dark...”
Reviews.Author: BethShan42
Reviews.Content: I often travel to Sydney for business and always stay in Surry Hills - nice restaurants, good hotels. On this occasion my grumpy colleague (and good friend) insisited we shake things up and stay somewhere different. He chose the Diamant and what a stinker that turned out to be. The staff were pleasant enough to me when I checked in but rude to my colleague when he arrvied earlier. I took the lift to my floor and as I dragged my suitcase down the corridor I overheard to burly blokes standing outside their adjoining rooms complaining about how badly lit their rooms were. I thought "what a bunch of sooks." Then I entered my room, turned on the light switch next to the bed which was as dim as a candle. I then spent the next half hour searching every inch of the place hoping and praying for more light... but there wasn't any. No ceiling lights. I kid you not!!! I had a pile of reading to do in preparation for meetings the next day and I couldn't see a thing. The only decent bit of light was in the toilet so I spent the evening sitting on the dunny. Things didn't improve during the night. The walls are paper thin and I heard every word (or grunt and groan) of the couple next door. It's as close as I've ever come to a threesome... and that's close enough! Would I return again. No, it's back to Surry Hills. Let there be light!!

Reviews.Title: “Tries to look the part, fails to deliver”
Reviews.Author: GilbertoAndJorge
Reviews.Content: We know the area and that there are a great selection of cafÃ©â€™s and restaurants around the hotel; a fresh breakfast and decent coffee are within a 10 minute stroll. Having lived in Sydney before we werenâ€™t looking to be right next door to any of the major sights or attractions. We found the hotel via the Mr & Mrs Smith website, and had reasonably high expectations for a boutique hotel with a bit of personality. I think the chief issue at the Diamant is the expectation set versus the final execution. Itâ€™s hard to be both a boutique and business hotel. The service would have fallen short for us had we been there for business; the check-in time is already fairly late and unfortunately our experience was similar to other reviewers: Sydneyâ€™s a long way from most places; you told us the check-in time, we arrived accordingly but were [unsurprisingly] tired, you seemed unconcerned and a bit gruff, we waited a good hour. Every query we put towards the front desk from that point on was treated in a similar manner; put to the end of a long list of tasks for various other guests. Fair enough, you're busy, but it would suggest you are therefore short-staffed. On the boutique scale of things, the rooms really fall down on their finishes. Aside from the lobby area, the hotel gives the conflicting impression of a building that wasnâ€™t really completed as intended, or that the design was not robust enough to carry the daily wear and tear of being a hotel. Corridor light bulbs were out, as were the wall lights in the bedroom, cables dangled from behind the badly fitted wall mounted TV, and the glossy paneled walls of the room were badly scuffed from â€¦ well, being a hotel room that will see quite a few cases and bags rolled through it. The intention was to look slick, but the quick bruising made everything feel shabby. All in all, we came away feeling a bit stung on the pricing, and perhaps that the larger percentage of the rate was for location rather than service or amenity. There is a fair bit to be made better at the Diamant.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, not delivering on promissed”
Reviews.Author: Ignasiktm
Reviews.Content: They saved my booking on a wrong day, and almost could not sleep there. Courtyard suite was cold (air gets through balcony door). No parking in spite of booking in advance. No bar or breakfast, slow people at reception... Looks (boutique?) are not everything

Reviews.Title: “Ultra Modern and So Very Sydney!”
Reviews.Author: Mancini_BXL
Reviews.Content: The Diamant is a fairly new hotel located on the edge of Kings Cross... under the famous Coca Cola sign. Ultra modern and refreshing, we were very surprised to enter our room which was dominated by a huge king sized bed that was draped in crisp linin and piled up with enough pillows for six. We noticed the lighting in the entire hotel was dim, it felt like 2am the whole stay. I found the room too dark and there was just no solution for that. The internet access is free in reception but costly in the rooms which is a slight negative in this hotel since they go to the trouble to include a iPod dock in each room. Close to public transport, walking distance to hundreds of (very good) restaurants, cafes and bars... not to mention the best nightlife in Sydney right at the door. Would stay here again, if only for that bed!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally. Not. Worth. It.”
Reviews.Author: ReceptionPlease
Reviews.Content: Rooms were DUSTY. Sheets and towels were SOILED. Parking was unessessarily difficult. I would NOT recommend this hotel to anyone. Service however, was more than helpful, but I can't help but feel that such efficiency was only delivered as an attempt to compensate for such a disappointing hotel. If however, location is what you're looking for, book a room here today. Transport is easily accessible with taxis constantly driving by and Kings Cross station 5 minutes away by foot. On a warm sunny day, try a 10-15 minute walk to Hyde Park :)

Reviews.Title: “Will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: hammockman
Reviews.Content: Thought this was going to be a boutique hotel. Neither of us liked it! Good location if your into the cross goings on. Apart from that, I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone! The entire hotel was pretty dark and gloomy, and felt a bit dodgy. Our room looked out onto a buildiing site. The windows were filthy, some of the fixings were loose. The bathroom was pokey and small. It wasn't good value. The only saving grace was the Twinnings tea provided for free! Avoid

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a short break in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: amycottage
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights during our visit to Sydney. The room was immaculate and the hotel itself was modern and clean. We had opted for the bottle of champagne on arrival which was in an ice bucket with chocolates which was a nice touch. Checking in was quick and efficient and the hotel itself was located close to a tube station. Not in the best of areas, but ideal for everything we wanted to do as tourists. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly quiet...”
Reviews.Author: RadiAnt333
Reviews.Content: Wanting 2days/1night in the City. Hotel claims to be in Potts Point - it's not.... it's smack bang near the massive neon 'Coke' sign in Kings Cross. Good spot tho. Asked for as quiet a room as possible - given one on the front of the hotel......surprisingly quiet!!! :)). Not 4*.... closer to 3.5*. Fairly clean. Like recently renovated hotels, this is no different. Smaller rooms and bathrooms, in order to get more rooms into hotel. Got booking thru Wotmail/Lastminute.com so got an upgraded room + 12pm checkout for $165. Good for Sydney prices and location :). Kings Cross has been 'cleaned up' a fair bit too. TV didn't work and phoning housekeeping/reception got no answer...... we arrived at 6pm and only one poor girl on reception doing everything. Got assistance around 11pm when we came back from dins. Very helpful and polite. Lighting in room was dreadful and very dark :(. mirrors almost useless without proper light. Nice dark block-out curtains tho for sleeping during daylight :). Spent the entire day after checkout shopping/visiting friends in the City - Hotel was so friendly and helpful that they offered and held our luggage until we returned late afternoon :)). Shocking weather at the time so it was a wonderful help. Minimal parking. On site costs $35/day.... We parked at Wilsons Parking at Potts Point end of Kings Cross Rd - short walk and only $20 for 24hrs :). Left the car there and used public transport or walked everywhere - great idea !

Reviews.Title: “helpful efficient staff, well furnished room, good bathroom, wonderful bed.”
Reviews.Author: gra03
Reviews.Content: Excellent location in the centre of Kings Cross in a quiet street.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel just ok”
Reviews.Author: Ulyssa2020
Reviews.Content: We had to stay a few days in Sydney for business reasons. My colleague and I decided to stay in that hotel following tripadvisor's recommendations. As promised, the hotel was nicely located and decorated. However, no one at the reception helped us with the luggage and was willing to make an extra effort when we needed some piece of information. No breakfast, as far as I can remember, and the room was cleaned below what's required. I thought the price was quite high for the service we got. One positive point though: the shampoo and conditioner provided in the bathroom were absolutely great!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: William_Mason
Reviews.Content: But could definitely be better, the toilet is rather torn and needs major attention from the hotel administration. 1.) the toilet needs to be more thoroughly cleaned, it is one of the more unbearable toilet and we saw traces of dirt on the toilet seat when we arrived, which was absolutely *disgusting*. 2.) one can easily notice traces of mold almost anywhere in the bathroom (but the affected area are relatively modest in size). The carpet also needs more attention, we suspect there are bedbugs hiding in the carpet, as we were bitten by small bugs after sitting on the ground for a while. The staffs are extremely friendly, and the location is terrific, it is only ~5 minutes of walk from the Kings cross train station, from there you could get to almost anywhere in Sydney (including the blue mountain and the hunter valley). Cole is just one street away and ADLI is one station away in the Edgecliff station. If they manage to make the toilet cleaner and eradicate the bugs in the carpets, we will consider to stay again. Otherwise there are a lot more options in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: sandptravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant for four nights and our overall feeling about the hotel was "good, not great." You choose to stay at the Diamant because of its reasonable pricing and we feel we got the value we paid for. The staff at the front desk were extremely kind and helpful. When our first room smelled like cigarette smoke they immediately moved us to another room on a different floor. They also helped us with several restaurant recommendations and one woman even walked outside with us to help orient us when giving directions. On the downside the rooms looked a little tired and there was some minor damage -- scuff marks on the walls, worn fabric on the chair etc...But overall the room provided everything we needed because we simply needed a safe and clean place to sleep at night since we were out sightseeing all day long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff, Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: kevinoleary89
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Diamant Hotel Sydney for 4 days in May, arrived late after a long flight from Hawaii, the front desk was efficient and friendly and had us in our room very quickly. They were also very helpful in pointing us to nearby restaurants that were just a few minutes away so we could get a late dinner. We stayed for 4 nights Friday till Tuesday and every question we asked of them was answered quickly with a smile. I can not say enough about how helpful they were. The Hotel is right on the edge of the Nightclub district but our room was quiet in great condition and very comfortable. It was within walking distance to everything in Sydney and the free wireless in the lobby came in very handy. Everything about the staff and hotel could not have been better; I can not wait to get back to Australia and will use the Diamant Hotel Sydney as our starting point again.

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true.”
Reviews.Author: JayneBosnich
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd of the 8Hotel boutiques we've stayed in in Sydney in the last year and plan on staying in the next one down the street on our next visit. Yes, boutique hotels have slightly smaller rooms, but WOW whomever decorated the rooms took advantage of the space. I don't find the rooms small, I find them cozy with plenty of room for my husband and I to get around. AND a HUGE plasma TV. Everyone working at the hotels is professional and very welcoming and obviously enjoy their jobs. The hotels are close to everything one could want; the quays, the city, lovely restaurants in a short walk and great cafes for breakfast......I could go on and on. All I know is these are the hotels we will always stay in. The price is not to be believed for such great amenties. Very clean rooms, lovely sheets and blankets, comfortable bed, coffee maker etc etc and close to everything. And close to trains and buses should you choose to venture on. We took a walk around the neighborhood last weekend and saw some beautiful homes that must date back to about 200yrs. Health clubs very near by. I don't know what else to say except if you want/or need it. You can get it in the 8Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING! This hotel ruined our stay in Sydney.”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneLu90
Reviews.Content: We booked this place to get away for the weekend and enjoy the nightlife of Kings Cross. Our stay however, turned into a nightmare while we had to endure noise all day long from the construction sites next door. The incessant sounds of jackhammers, machinery, excavation and drills drove us crazy. We could not go out to come back and listen to it with a hangover, aaahhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: LNguyen24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant during our first visit to Sydney and it was very pleasant. We booked directly through the hotel's website and got the room at a great rate of $150/night. My husband called and said it was our honeymoon so they upgraded us to a a bigger room. The room was a perfect size for two people and we had a great view of the city. The location of the hotel is great -- close to a lot of restaurants and bars but can be quite a walk if you're trying to get to the Opera House or Harbour Bridge. About 10 minutes to Bondi by car and 20 minutes from the airport without traffic. The front desk staff was always so helpful and friendly. Anytime we needed help they were always so nice and resourceful. I would stay at this hotel again based on the customer service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Could you please turn the light on?”
Reviews.Author: CaboGirl
Reviews.Content: Traveled April 2011 with a friend. Here's the scoop: Sounds silly but I would not stay here again because the room is so unbelievably dark that it is impossible to get ready, put on makeup, or read once the sun goes down. I have never seen such a dark hotel room - it was almost comical. I'm in my 30s with fine eyesight - the lighting is simply atrocious. We asked for a floor lamp and were brought a desk lamp that did absolutely nothing. Seems like a bright floor lamp would go a long way. Bathroom lighting was also horrible. That said.. a bit more information... The front desk staff is marvelous - helpful, friendly and very pleasant. There is a gym next door and it is free when you are staying in the hotel. There is also a wine bar attached, which was nice, although there was never anyone in there. A bit outside the central city, but King's Cross Metro stop is right around the corner and very convenient. We walked to the Opera House one day and it took about an hour. Easy access via metro to Bondi junction where you can get a bus to bondi beach. Room was ok...nothing spectacular, but perfectly acceptable. Asked for 2 beds - got two twins pushed together. A bit small but manageable. Free wireless internet in the lobby but it was unbelievably slow. Late night nightclub around the corner.. forget the name of it. Booked on wotif.. spent about $180/nt.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel for a get-away weekend”
Reviews.Author: trelise
Reviews.Content: We were made to feel very welcome by the friendly reception staff - very helpful and keen to share local knowledge. Our room (on the 5th Floor) was quiet and everything we needed - things that you usually have to ask for were there - ironing board, hairdryer and great toiletries in the bathroom. Umbrellas supplied when it rained. Bed was so comfortable - (could the management let us know what it was!). Hotel is within walking distance of some great eating places/cafes etc & not far from the CBD. Only small issue was - the room could have done with an uplighter or reading lights as very difficult to read at night. Overall, would certainly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms not sound proof”
Reviews.Author: Tirtytreeandaturd
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights In a standard room. Staff were helpful and friendly. Room was small. Bathroom was average. Tv remote was difficult to work. Think it was faulty. But our main gripe was that the room was not sound proof. It was easy hear doors closing, toilets flushing etc. Also I suspect that The windows were not doubled glazed so the passing traffic could be heard from the room. On a brighter note the bed was a good size and was comfy. But overall I probably would not stay there again due to the noise level.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angelntinks
Reviews.Content: Loved this little boutique hotel, very clean and comfortable and extremely friendly staff. Rooms were decent size, only downside was no tea and coffee in room and beds quite hard. Also no restaurant in hotel, so no breakfast available, this was across the road. Good location, although on the top of a steep hill. Great place to stay though.

Reviews.Title: “Massively Disappointing, don't stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: timetomeeow
Reviews.Content: The ONLY good thing about this hotel is it's location, which is brilliant. Everything else is massively sub-standard. The rooms are average at best - we stayed in a Deluxe Double for 11 nights and it was tiny, with a tiny bathroom with little privacy. I've stayed in standard rooms at half the price in other boutique hotels which have been vastly superior. The beds were uncomfortable with horrible bedding and rubbish pillows, and the towels in the bathroom were small white regular cheap towels...no bath sheets or any kind of luxury here!!! You'd not know it from the price though! This hotel is like a rubbish serviced apartment. The finishing on the look of the hotel throughout is shabby, though you wouldn't get this impression from the website. Our room wasn't made up a number of times if we weren't out of it by around 10am, and walls are THIN in this hotel so you can hear people walking/talking when they go past your room...slamming doors...everything. There is no Wifi ANYWHERE in the hotel apart from at the reception. The room service is exorbitant and brought in from outside delivery places - everything from a bowl of pasta with tomato sauce to a buger is $27. Literally. There's nowhere in the hotel to sit and have a coffee...or breakfast...or anything. The staff are reasonably friendly, but there's no hope of getting any kind of help with your luggage here - we also complained about the fact our TV remote didn't work from the first day (sub-standard audio visual throughout) and even though it was mentioned time and again they still didn't manage to get it sorted in 11 days!!. Oh, and if you do decide to stay in this terrible excuse for a hotel, do be careful when you check out as they took an extra Â£360 from my bank account...denied it (even though I had proof on my bank statement)..and then refunded it, still claiming to have no knowledge of it!!! BE WARY. I can't recommend strongly enough that you stay ELSEWHERE if you go to Sydney - this is one of the worst hotels I've ever stayed in!!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: GilbertAndGeorge
Reviews.Content: I recently went to Sydney for 4 nights to visit family and friends. Having grown up in Sydney, I picked Diamant for it's location and the fact that it seemed to be a nice upmarket boutique hotel which is what we normally go for. My husband and I were so disappointed when we checked in. The room was large enough, however it was old, worn out and just plain boring and not what you would expect from a luxury boutique hotel. There were cables from the TV exposed and hung loosely on the walls, the walls were scratched and had markings on it and the carpet worn out and old, reminded of old office carpet. The bathroom was small and resembled something that I would expect to find in a Best Western Inn at the very best. The corridors were dark and dingy. Some of the light bulbs had blown out and after 4 days had still not been repaired so flickered on and off. If you are after a no frills hotel in Sydney, this is fine. Location is excellent though, very close to all the great cafes, boutiques in Potts Point. Overall, a very disappointing effort from the hotel group, I was expecting a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great value and good location”
Reviews.Author: Morumbi
Reviews.Content: Was my second time at the Diamant and I really like this hotel. The service is fantastic better than many 5 stars European hotels. The location is very good, Potts Point is one of the best areas in Sydney with trendy restaurants and people just 2 mins walk from the hotel. Also another plus is the gym pass. The only thing I dont like there is the bathrooms, I like it big and there even the suite doesn't got a big bathroom but you can't have everything can you?

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and modern with one FATAL flaw”
Reviews.Author: dannydinosaur
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay at the Diamant when I first arrived: great location with convenient access to both the city centre and inner suburbs, near a cute part of Victoria and Oxford Streets, the seedy part of Darlinghurst was easy to ignore, the front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and the room itself was spacious with a huge bed and nice modern design. Everything seemed great... until I tried to sleep. The sound-proofing is pretty terrible throughout the hotel. Every time someone opened the door to their room, I'd hear it. Conversations, televisions, everything can be heard through the walls, doors, and ceilings. I even had a white noise machine to block out the sounds but I could still hear it all. This was actually the second place I stayed in Australia that had a great look but poor sound insulation, and Diamant's was extremely poor. The other complaint I have is with the Internet access-- Diamant had free wi-fi in the lobby but it didn't extend to the rooms. Room access was very expensive, something like $20 a day, and it required an Ethernet cable-- no wireless, which is fine for laptops but useless for smartphones. I wish I liked the Diamant more, I really wanted to, and it does have some great features like location, staff, and aesthetics. They just need to do an overhaul of the insulation and upgrade their Internet situation and it would be a great hotel. But unfortunately I can't really recommend it due to the noise.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lskmuse
Reviews.Content: Inwould go out of my way to stay here again. In fact I would not stay anywhere else in Sydney. An immaculate comfortable hotel with friendly and helpful staff and a great bed! The location was perfect near all public transport for the beach and major attractions. I would not call this a 'budget' hotel: I would call it absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: HolidayhoundLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Diamant hotel for 2 nights in early January 2011. The staff were very helpful and accommodating and the room was very spacious and comfortable. We stayed in three hotels in Sydney and this was perhaps the least desirable in terms of location, but what it lacked in location it made up for in comfort and style, and at the price was the most reasonable hotel we stayed in. There is no breakfast on offer but there are plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby which offer all sorts of choices for breakfast. The hotel is a very short walk from Kingâ€™s Cross station and the bars and restaurants of Darlinghurst. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a good value base for exploring Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive and stylish boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeB1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant for one night before flying back to the UK the next morning. We arrived late (about 11pm) and were given a free upgrade to the next type of room. The room was very stylish and modern, with nice boutique hotel touches like a big TV, iPod dock and so on. I think the lighting was a bit too dark for my taste - even with all the lights on I would have found it hard to read at night. The location was fine for us as we were really just using it as a pit stop before our flight. I think I would choose somewhere more central if I was just starting my stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “More of a business hotel, well connected, close to a RLD and loud area”
Reviews.Author: Vikas J
Reviews.Content: The Diamant Hotel was value for money. Nice clean room, a bit dark with inadequate lighting though. Had all the basic facilities. No restaurant yet but apparently one is being made as of now. It was well connected with bus stops, and rail stations very nearby. Its a bit of a walk to the Darling Harbour but manageable. The exact location was a bit loud and was very near the Red Light District so it could be a bit unsafe but it can easily be avoided. The plus point of the same was that a lot of eating joints were open till late which is tough to find in Australia A highlight was free internet in the lobby - a rare feature in Australian hotels

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, outstanding Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinfusion
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic stay at the Diamant Hotel. Our room was modern and comfortable. We very much enjoyed it and the employees at the hotel were very friendly and helpful! The location was perfect for visiting Sydney and we would recommend it to all travellers. The ambiente at the hotel was cool, stylish and the price we payed was fair.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location - Beautiful Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Miapeders83
Reviews.Content: I just love this hotel... the location is amazing and the rooms are so beautiful and deluxe inside. There is a 50" plasma which I have never seen in a hotel room, and this was a truly amazingly serviced hotel. The staff are all so helpful, and the room was cleaned thoroughly each morning. The restaurant beside the hotel is called Time To Vino, and I had 3 of the best dinners and wines there; I definitely recommend the hotel to those staying on business or travelling for fun in Potts Point.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy little hotel”
Reviews.Author: mattypoika
Reviews.Content: We checked in pretty late and had to check out pretty early as we had an early flight, but the time that we had at the hotel was great. The room was nice and clean and there was a great view looking out onto the street and city. We were given complementary gifts and had no problems at all. The staff were friendly and a good time was had by all.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, modern and well equipped rooms”
Reviews.Author: oh1984
Reviews.Content: This hotel doesn't quite seem to fit into the sleazy and rowdy Kings Cross area, but that doesn't stop it from being great value for money. The hotel itself is ultra modern, staff are very friendly and rooms are very comfortable, spacious and well equipped - large TV, iPod dock, walk-in shower etc. The CBD is a 15 minute walk away, and Kings Cross station is 30 seconds around the corner. On a night Kings Cross is very busy with revellers, if you want something quieter and more elegant, the restaurants and pubs at Wooloomooloo are only a 15 minute walk away. All guests get complimentary use of the Fitness First around the corner. The only reason the sleep quality is rated low is because there were significant construction works taking place on a neighbouring building (and looked like they would be continuing for some time), which woke both myself and my girlfriend up every morning at 6:30, including Saturday! The hotel did leave a note and some earplugs in the room to compensate, however it is not ideal and we were not informed of the works until we walked into the room and found the note.

Reviews.Title: “Made reservation but......no hotel to stay in!!!”
Reviews.Author: Snooki1985
Reviews.Content: I was very keen at staying at the Diamant for awhile,finally made a reservation for a saturday because my partner and i wanted to go out with friends to Kings cross! Made the reservation on a Tuesday night for the Saturday of that weekend! On the Friday before, i got very sick and contacted the hotel to cancel our reservation i called the hotel at round 7.45am i was told that it was "fine,and everything was cancelled" no cancellation number was given??? I decided to go back to bed now that i had cancelled the reservation.I woke up to find a voicemail left by the Manager herself asking me to contact the hotel in regards to my "reservation"? I called the hotel back and i spoke to the staff member who had actually made the reservation for me,i asked what was wrong and i had no reservation anymore that it was cancelled? The receptionist actually said to me that my reservation was made for the Thursday not for Saturday and that they would have to charge me a nights stay,which worked out to about $120 i tried saying to the receptionist calmly that i had booked my room for the saturday she was adamant that i booked it for the Thursday and i would have to pay anyway???? At this point i was FURIOUS! Why should i have to pay for someones mistake? I was then put on the phone to the Manager,she was also very adamant about the reservation being booked for the Thursday instead of the Saturday,and that she sends customers "confirmation emails" which in actual fact i never got if i had i would have rang the hotel and asked them why my my room was booked for Thursday (which is no good to me) and it wasnt booked for the Saturday?I asked the Manager what would have happened if i had shown up on the Saturday as planned and reserved according to me? She had nothing to say but to speak over me (very professional i say) I told her i was not going to pay for it she said that they were going to charge me anyway! As soon as i got off the phone with her i contacted my bank and they said that they had already tried to take the money from my account on the Thursday but thought it was a little strange as though this was not a direct debit of any sort that i had set up,which means that they could not access any money (im glad to have such a great bank)!!! Overall i have NEVER had a problem with any 5*hotel,and they always tend to be in more demand than a 3-4*hotel,i actually was very discouraged because i was looking forward to staying at this hotel,but now im VERY glad i didnt! In conclusion extremely shocking customer service,even before you get to the hotel reception desk!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Know what you're getting into”
Reviews.Author: Lookin4Deals
Reviews.Content: My husband I recently stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. Pros: Nice location, get breakfast included as they give you a voucher to 2 nearby restaurants that were delicious, friendly staff. Cons: Old, run down and horribly maintained hotel. There were paint stains in the elevators from having the second floor painted (no attention to detail on a maintenance level). Minimal to zero lighting in the rooms including the bathroom. Yes, it is that contemporary dark look but was so dark that we were unable to read in bed at night. Drunken middle of the night fights in the hallways (on just Fri. and Sat. night). Dried blood stains on the comforter and something more unmentionable on the artwork on the walls (someone had rubbed something disgusting on the art). I'd only stay at this hotel again if I were paying $99 US dollars per night and that's a stretch.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: raz79
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my partner for my birthday. The hotel & our room was nice, clean and trendy. The room had a huge balcony had with a great view of the city. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel had a great location walking distance, to Sydneys premier nightlife, cafes and transport. The room was was clean and tidy and had a charm to it that you dont normally see in hotel rooms. would definately recommend to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Norbie42
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel in a good location (railway nearby, 25-30 minutes walk to main attractions). I only missed a lamp on the table (I really would have troubles with the light if I would have had to work in the evening) and it would be a good idea to clean at least sometimes behind the TV screens. Can be recommended for a stay in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing”
Reviews.Author: happytourist29
Reviews.Content: Room had a great view of the city and was clean and comfortable with everything i needed. The staff were friendly and helpful and got me taxis when i needed and gave me info on where to go for food and recommended a lovely cafe for a great breakfast. The hotel was in a great location just a 2 minute walk from underground station and 20 minute walk into city centre although there were some great bars and restaurants in the Kingscross area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: SFdave70
Reviews.Content: Staff is friendly. Rooms are modern and clean. Wi-fi is available for free in internet, yet was very slow. Wi-fi available in room, yet is somewhat expensive. Very convenient to Kings Cross Station.

Reviews.Title: “Location, rooms, staff, management all fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: trippedNarrabri
Reviews.Content: I really love staying at the Diamant Potts Point and always look forward to going back there. I am usually going to Sydney for a concert or a special party and the location of the Diamant, the friendly staff and the wonderful beds always enhances my experience of Sydney. Recently I had to go for medical tests at St. Vincents and, once again, the Diamant was most certainly the best place for me to stay. Home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Take it or leave it”
Reviews.Author: sunnyredblueyellow
Reviews.Content: Small rooms. Dark hallways. Modern style is nice. Hotel staff not so enthusiastic. Location is convenient. King's cross is "interesting". Glad that we didn't stay here for long. But it wasn't Bate's hotel either. Take it or leave it. Actually, leave it if you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Very good & comfortable hotel at a superb location!”
Reviews.Author: SHE095
Reviews.Content: The Diamant hotel is greatly located in the city of Sydney. Everybody knows the Coca Cola sign, where the hotel is directly located. When you walk out of the hotel, all you have to do is walk straight down to get in the city centre or the harbour. It is modernly furbished and very comfortable. Employees are young and very service orientated. There is no restaurant to have breakfast or dinner, but you do not need that either, it is much more fun to go out! In the direct vicinity you will find plenty of restaurants and bars. Kings Cross is just around the corner too and if you are looking for the best cocktail in town, you have to visit the cocktail bar of the Kirketon hotel which is on walking distance and belongs to the same company. I would recommend this hotel to anyone that is visiting Sydney!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service,”
Reviews.Author: hettyrokebrand
Reviews.Content: The staff of the Diamant Hotel was very friendly, professionel en helpfull,the rooms were well equiped,and clean , also very good beds, and shower The location very good, almost in de middle of he city. We were very content during our stay in the hotel en intend to come back next time when we are in Sidney

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: rjs121
Reviews.Content: I read the previous reviews on this and booked straight away, thinking wow, this will be ideal. Clearly set my expectations way too high. Hotel itself: good, some of the front desk staff were helpful, in good condition, room was ok, not a great view but we were only on floor 5 of 12 - however, it is bizarrely very poorly lit and some of the staff made me feel as if I'd been scraped off the bottom of their shoe. What you need to prepare yourself for is the area it's in: really easy access from the airport as it was only 30 minutes with one step by train (easier and definitely cheaper and more practical than using a car in the city by the way) but then you arrive at Kings Cross - I don't know if it was the druggie beggie who had permanent residence at the entrance to the station or the 24 hour pub next door but when I went out one morning to find lots of people vomitting on the pavement, tipping alcohol everywhere, lying plastered in their own drool, I vowed never to out before 7am again. It realy is revolting. The noise from bars, drunken idiots, car horns and emergency service sirens on the Friday and Saturday kept my husband up all night and that was with all windows closed and ear plugs in - horrendous. So nice hotel, shame about the location.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, awesome staff!”
Reviews.Author: poscarini
Reviews.Content: Arrived at about 3:30PM to sign in. All went smoothly, grabbed the keys and brought the car to the carpark. An usher was there to advise the best parking spot and helped me get close enough to the wall so the car was nicely tucked away. :) Got into the room and it was beautiful! Great space, lovely bathroom, great bed! A few of the furnishings were a bit worn and torn but still presented greatly. We got a courtyard room and I was really pleased with it. Really nice sized courtyard, good for a gathering with a few people. The one thing I must rave about is the staff... They were absolutely incredibly accomodating throughout our whole stay. Literally at 4AM we wanted some ice for our drinks and they had no problem bringing it to us. Any requests we had were taken care of with no hesitation and they really made sure we were happy. The only thing wrong with the room was the air conditioning not working so we did get a tad cold during the night. We could have asked them to have a look at it but we didn't want to bother them and it wasn't too cold anyway. All in all a really really great stay and would definitely come back and stay. Thank you staff!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller360
Reviews.Content: First, I was unsure if it was a good decision to stay in King's Cross. But once I was there, I loved it. You really can't call it a red light district. It is a mix of great restaurants, cafes, shops and only a little bit "red light". The Diamant is just a minute away from the subway station and actually it is no problem to walk to the CBD, either. The lobby of the hotel is very stylish with great front office staff. Rooms are spacious with a cool design (which I personally liked). The only annoying thing is that the bathroom floor gets wet when you shower. There should be also free WiFi in the room nowadays. I could not imagine where else you get such great value in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “All Receptionists did not have a clue what they were doing”
Reviews.Author: thetraveller86
Reviews.Content: The night receptionist was clueless - he made our check in 45 minutes long! I felt bad for the long line of people who still had to check in. When we finally had gone upstairs to the rooms, everything was very very dark. The couch was discustingly dirty! I did however like about the hotel that it was in an excellent location to all the night clubs. When we had checked out again it was chaos! First of all the receptionist had disappeared for about 15 - 20 minutes. They do not have any local knowlegde of Sydney - We wanted to go to some funcky shops, restaurants and they had no idea what was going on. poor poor service!

Reviews.Title: “Good value but not as high class as it looks”
Reviews.Author: PDX-PDX-PDX-PDX
Reviews.Content: Stayed for six days. Easy to get to and find. Came from the airport via train and walked from Kings Cross station (from the airport-line train it's just one transfer at Central Station). Check-in was easy. They held my bags from my arrival at 8am until my room was ready at noon. Sleek lobby. Dark, dark hallways (it's meant to look trendy I guess). The room was also quite dark once the sun went down and there is little extra lighting. I don't think they expect you to read in bed because you can't. The promised $35 per stay internet rate they advertise on their website does not exist; it's $20/day and no WiFi in the room. There is free but slow wireless internet in the lobby (although you must ask for a new code each day). During the weekdays the hotel was very quiet. On the weekends the hotel is full of loud, drunken guests which explains why some of the once obviously high-quality furnishings are now a bit run down. The bed and linens were high quality. Towels less so. Toiletries were only replaced once in my 6-night stay. There is a kettle with tea and instant coffee that was refreshed most days. The location is great. Plenty of places to eat nearby. Very close to the metro station and just 15-minute walk to the CBD, opera house, even Darling harbor is easily walkable. The staff were pleasant and helpful to me but seemed a bit rude to some of the other guests at times it seems. Check out was very easy. I got a great rate using frequent flyer miles. No extraneous charges (even taxes were included in paying with FF miles). Trains are frequent and it's a short trip back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great first impressions, but it goes down-hill fast!”
Reviews.Author: Ingmar53
Reviews.Content: From the very friendly desk staff to the sleek contemporary lobby design, first impressions at the Diamont are, well... impressive. But you quickly realize that form regretfully triumphs over function. While I appreciate the low-energy efforts at lighting, I still want to be able to read in bed, which you cannot do with the dim room lighting... nor can you even see to pack your bags before sunlight enters your room in the morning. The sleek design of the bathrooms is lovely---BUT wouldn't it be nice to have a place to actually hang your towels that is not IN the shower? Most annoying was the trendy hanging glass door to the bathroom, which the cleaning person knocked off track, and it couldn't be repaired for 4 DAYS, and there were no free rooms to which we could be relocated. Imagine sharing a room even with a spouse, but not being able to close the bathroom door and having to physically squeeze into the bathroom because the door was stuck midway... for 4 days! Our stay included a weekend, and be forewarned that the hotel is taken over from Friday evening to Sunday morning by 4-to-a-room 20-somethings who are there to PARTY! The Diamont is around the corner from Kings Cross party-central, and the crowd in the room above us seemed to be jumping up and down in the room continuously until about 3 a.m. Music blared from the room next door all night. Drunken partiers also kindly redirected all the dim hallway lights to shine horizontally into your eyes. Free wifi is only available in the lobby, which requires you to request an individual code and password each day. And DON'T use the internet through the flat-screen TV in your room. It is slow as a snail and costs $11 a pop. At the time of our stay, the restaurants in the hotel had all gone under.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it-but noisy on weekends”
Reviews.Author: phil32530
Reviews.Content: I booked a standard room with two beds and confirmed in an email. That's exactly what I got. The beds were clean and comfy with topsheets covering the blankets. Safe and in room coffee were included. bathrooms were a bit trendy with a glass wall near the shower and open to the elements at the far end. So don't splash too much. Nice big screen TV and the AC worked fine. The room itself had only one complaint. The bulbs are really dim and you can't really read at night. The location is great, you're close to the King's Cross station and the nightlife. The only problem is on the weekend the clubs play music so loud I could hear them from the 5th floor. Bring earplugs or go out and party on the weekends. I paid an extremely reasonable AUD 120 a night for 4 nights. That's a steal in Sydney for a centrally located hotel. There is no restaurant as such, only room service breakfast. i just walked to the Coles supermarket and browsed the various fast food restaurants. There is a fridge but it's one of those where it's only for hotel minibar. There's also an iron and board, very handy. The wireless internet is available in the lobby for free but is only good for checking email. There is a laptop at the check in for you to use which is a lot faster if you want to look things up. Strangely, I only saw the concierge for about an hour the whole time I was there. He doesn't work weekends. How odd. I recommend this as an entirely reasonable boutique hotel. It's centrally located and well priced. the staff were very good and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: AriDeu
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this place very much. I loved the location (outside of the regular CBD area) with little stores, restaurants and cafes on Victoria Street, right near by and the value of the hotel was awesome. The room was very clean and I loved the decor of the rooms and hallways, very trendy and stylish (being from Manhattan to me it had the flair and style of our Soho or Meatpacking District areas, very cool). For older generation it might be a little to stylish or "clubish", with the dark furniture and especially the very dimmed lights in the hallways and lounge music playing. I loved it. The staff was very helpful and friendly in all matters. It is a 20 to 25 minute walk to the sights around the Harbor or a short cab ride. I would stay at this place definitely again.

Reviews.Title: “The staff are so nice and all to happy to help in any situation .”
Reviews.Author: tvisle68
Reviews.Content: I stayed two of the most enjoyable nights ever in a hotel .The hotel is so nice, very modern, stylish and well appointed. The staff are so nice and all to happy to help in any situation .Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Handy location, good value”
Reviews.Author: BecandB
Reviews.Content: So it's not five star but you get very good value if you can get a room at a special rate. The hotel is well located, close to the city and key entertainment and shopping areas. The decor is very modern (albeit a little masculine, lots of black) and the rooms were quiet despite being on a very busy intersection. If you are looking for a good place to stay where you don't really need extra services and a comfortable space to sleep then I would recommend this hotel. If I was being picky I'd say they need to sort out the lifts (they are shared with some commercial levels between reception and the rooms which causes long delays) and the staff could try smiling every now and then but otherwise this is a good value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: M3002
Reviews.Content: This is a great location to stay. The hotel was inexpensive but the service was good and the room was fine. The decor is a bit odd, and there is some traffic noise, but it was made up for by free access to the local gym.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do the Diamant”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_dude13
Reviews.Content: These remarks pertain to a standard room on the third floor; the â€œalleyâ€� view was of an old building under renovation. The room itself was very modern, appeared recently renovated, and had potential, but lacked the cleanliness that I would expect (for example, the dark carpets showed lint/dust everywhere, and did not look like it was vacuumed prior to my arrival and was not vacuumed the second night either). The toiletries were half used/not replaced when I arrived. The bathroom had no bathtub, and after a 15.5 hour flight from Vancouver, a tub would have been nice. Also, the shower stall only had a tiny strip separating it from the main bathroom floor and so the water pooled on the bathroom floor, even with towels placed on the floor. I also had to wait until the official check-in time for my room when I arrived. The hotel is â€œboutiqueâ€� which means no pool, but complimentary access to a Fitness First gym, just around the corner, was appreciated. The hotelâ€™s restaurant was not open during my stay, either for breakfast or dinner. The internet access was $20 per day in the room, or $11 using the television internet (the latter I would definitely NOT recommend â€“ I purchased it for one day, but gave up after a futile 40 minutes trying to get my email). Complimentary access was available in the lobby, but you need to ask front desk staff for a personalized login and password. Front desk staff were friendly/helpful, but the hotel had no specific bellman or concierge. The television also had limited channels. The room refrigerator was full soft drinks, etc. and had no room for my own beverages. I had been familiar with the neighbourhood because of a previous visit to Sydney, so I knew what I was getting; but I didnâ€™t know the Kings Cross subway station was closed which made it inconvenient to get downtown/central business district or to/from the airport. I would not recommend this area to anyone preferring an upscale neighbourhood, shopping or seeking a hotel within walking distance to Sydneyâ€™s main tourist attractions, like the Harbour Bridge or Opera House. The area is a little â€œrough around the edges.â€� So, would I recommend this hotel to family and friends, or stay here again? A resounding NO and NO. Give me a big, American chain any day. By the way, Iâ€™m checking out after two days, and moving to the Westin Sydney which is much more expensive, but hopefully worth it. And I was quite surprised by how favourably this hotel was rated by previous guests which was why I booked this hotel, so please be heed these comments.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Chris1951
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. My husband and I loved staying here. We moved from another hotel because it was cheaper but we are glad we did. It isn't as close to the Opera House but the bus was not a long ride. Daniel and Adrian at the front desk took such good care of us. What pleasant personalities and how helpful they were! The rooms were so charming and had large flat screen TVs. We were impressed! Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: acdc3301
Reviews.Content: I spent 9 days as a solo traveler before my husband joined me after his motorcycle trip in NZ for another 4 days. I scare easily and I have to say that I felt safe and secure the entire time. The rooms are kind of small and the tv channels are limited but I slept very well every night and the mini bar was pretty good. The staff was always pleasant and very helpful. Nic is especially great. The location on the cusp of Potts Point and Kings Cross was excellent. It's centrally located for everything relevant about Sydney. There are many good cafes and restaurants near by and a grocery store literally next door. The metro is steps away and there is a great coffee stand right around the corner. I would return to this hotel next time I'm in Sydney and sincerely recommend it. I did a lot of research and you really can't beat the price for all that you get from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Smart Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StegLondon
Reviews.Content: Good rooms, trendy decor. Really friendly knowledgeable staff and not over priced. All this and only a 10 dollar cab ride to the CBD. Great choice if like me you need a handy hotel to spend a couple of days whilst seeing to business in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: katydeee
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the last year and a bit. It is still good value for Sydney. Large, simply but smartly decorated rooms - really friendly staff. Shame there isn't the art injection here that the Canberra Diamant has on show. Cost saving / or cutting corners are apparent since our last stay, eg: restaurant is gone and replaced by a take away menu - double the price in comparison to getting yourself and delivered to your room with plastic cutlery, no knapkins and no plates..breakfast is at a cafe around the corner - which was great. Goodies in the room eg: shampoos seem a bit cheap. Towels seem a litte tired. Overall tho - pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edgar-NL
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice during our Australia trip. A little bit noisy, but you are in a city and close to a few nightlife hotspots so what else to expect! Booked a twin room and that wasn't available unfortunately so we got two rooms for the first night. Good service, but I wonder why it's so difficult to make sure the room that is booked is available. But anyway, it didn't screwed up our stay. No breakfast facilities. Suggested spot for breakfast: Number 9 (read it is closed now, but I'm not sure).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for experiencing the rest of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: MBinSF
Reviews.Content: We staying in the CBD at the beginning of our Australian adventure, and decided to stay outside the City on our second round. We had ventured through Kings Cross before our stay, so we knew it would be a little loud and crazy, but we also knew it would be lively at night. Our room was on a high floor, large and very modernly furnished. The location was perfect. We easily walked to dinner in Surry Hills or simply around the corner. The staff were extremely helpful and assisted us with whatever we needed. They do not have a gym, but they have passes to Fitness First around the corner, which is better than a hotel gym any day! Our first complaint is that the walls are fairly thin and we could hear our neighbors and people in the halls. That noise was more disturbing that the noise on the street. Our second (minor) complaint is that the hotel does not have a restaurant or bar. Although there are many within a stone's throw, it would be nice to have one that is only an elevator ride away from home. All in all, the Diamant is great and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MODERNNYC
Reviews.Content: We choose this property because of its location to friends, bars and the fact that it is outside of the normal hotel cluster in the CBD. The location is ideal and the price we paid was really ideal as well. Given the fact that the price was not luxury I wasn't expecting the hotel to be luxury either...and it wasn't. The bathroom was tight and felt cramped, the furnishings felt a little bit like a discount version of a W or some similar hotel, and at times the "trendy" design simply seemed misguided. I was told the hotel was relatively new, but there did seem to be a lot of dents in furniture and stains on the rug. Alas, nothing terrible. Despite these relatively minor criticisms, the hotel suited our needs perfectly -- clean, great staff, central location, not a cooke-cutter chain, and it had some style.
