The linens and bed were comfortable and we got free gym passes (that would normally be around $25) for the Fitness First next door which beats a tiny hotel gym any day. All in all, a good choice for the kids who want to be close to Darlinghurst and Oxford Street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic accomodation in the heart of Sydney, perfect for a break in the city!”
Reviews.Author: dewdropLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights as a stop-over, on our way to New Zealand and it was a perfect destination. It did exactly what it said it would, providing clean, trendy accomodation in the heart of Sydney! We loved the flat screen t.v and access to the internet but we also loved the clean lines and modern design. We had a courtyard room which was brilliant for having a glass of wine outside before dinner! Must also say that I was worried about the potential noise in this busy part of town but I wasn't disturbed at any point with noise from any direction! The staff were friendly and helpful and the whole experience was delightful! When next in Sydney I will be staying at the Diamant for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: 02retired
Reviews.Content: For a reasonable rate and a location that can't be denied do stay at this hotel right in the entertainment area and very close to public transportation. The hotel is very clean and the staff very helpful. However, if you are looking for a four star accomadation look elsewhere. The room is large and comfortable but you have to look for the coffee maker and it is not readibly accessable along with the safe. The room we booked only had a walk in shower with a missing place to set your soap or shampoo. Small problems when you consider the price.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond Class Diamant”
Reviews.Author: thepathlesstaken
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just had the good fortune of discovering a real gem amongst Sydney's boutique hotels. The Diamant is a Hotel that definately punches above its weight. If you want clean classy modern accomodation then I highly recommend this Hotel. Its about giving a high standard of accomodation for those people that dont need a sauna, spa, pool or 24/7 room service. The reception staff were very helpful, polite and efficient making us feel welcome and appeciated. Its got all the ingredients of the big 5 star places (the foyer has its polished marble or stone floors, the bose stereo with background music for ambience, the clean and shiny lifts, clean fresh carpets in common areas, big screen plasma's in the bedrooms, the best shower gel I have had to date in any Hotel bar none and all the little things you expect from a major name in the Hotel industry!). So, if as i say, its about accomodation and not the pool or the spa, the gym or the in-house dining then you get a hell of a lot for your money at the Diamant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, rooms in need of a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: somanyhotels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diamant for business and the location could not be better if you want to explore the different shades of Sydney from the grunginess of Kings Cross to great restaurants and shopping in Potts point, Darlinghurst and Surry Hills. However the rooms are dark and feature black decor which I found a bit depressing. The style was probably edgy at first but is now looking dated and tired.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Tired and Not of 5 Star Standard”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel in a good location, but sadly its glory days have passed. Rooms look tired and in need of maintenance (stains on carpets, marks on walls). Staff were very plesasant and accommodating. On balance, for a good rate you could do far worse, but for the more expensive rooms you can find much better value in Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - much better hotels in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: Flash123Cork
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in the Diamant & must say it was the worst hotel of our holiday (actually one of the worst ever). We had selected the summer promotion which was suppose to have a free upgrade yet we got nothing the first night and the rate was higher than I had booked. When I asked about the summer promotion I was told the hotel was fully booked but there was no way it was. We had to get the bed changed as there were 'stains' on the sheets (nasty) & although they had tried to make the room 'Boutique' it was shabby and needed a refresh. The safe didnt work, the TV didnt work etc. We headed out to walk around Kings Cross - that was an eye opener and needless to stay we didnt stay out long, not our type of place. We did get the room changed on the Sunday, a bit bigger with a balcony but still not great & we were glad to be only there one more night. We headed out for the day & only got back late enough - they did leave a bottle of bubbly in the room but all too little too late. Wouldn't stay here again or recommend it

Reviews.Title: “comfortable, stylish, location location! awesome staff! loved it!”
Reviews.Author: adapt2pt
Reviews.Content: I stayed two of the most enjoyable nights ever in a hotel! I got upgraded from the Kirketon to the Diamant and they didnt disapoint at all! The hotel is so nice, very modern, stylish and well appointed. The staff are so nice and all to happy to help in any situation I had a bit of a blonde moment when it came to doing the internet and then for some weird reason the tv decided it didnt want to work on day two :( but they gave me a free breakfast at the local Cafe Bondi - lovely staff and good food too! loved the free Fitness First gym pass! (im a personal trainer so was great to use the gym) loved the Ipod speaker station (the one time i didnt bring my Ipod! ) but i could still plug my mobile or Mp3 player into it and play my music! everything was great and i felt like it was my home away from home all in all i really enjoyed my time and will be recommending people to stay there in the future and i can't wait to stay at the rest of the 8 hotels! Paris here I come! haha

Reviews.Title: “All-around great package”
Reviews.Author: katiekins570
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at this hotel. We were originally booked at their sister hotel, the Altamont, but our reservation had been lost. Despite this inauspicious beginning, we were upgraded to the Diamant due to lack of space at the Altamont. They honored our original rate as well. All around, what could have been a disaster turned into a lovely stay. First of all, the hotel staff was very helpful--apologetic and helpful in getting us a new booking, friendly throughout our two-night stay. The room was very nice and comfortable. It had a trendy look to it while at the same time maintaining a high standard of comfort. Nice toiletries in the bathroom--only complaint would be the shower gets the bathroom floor a bit wet. The location was also superb--right in the heart of Kings Cross/Darlinghurst, walkable to the CBD and many other fun neighborhoods, practically on top of the Kings Cross metro stop. It was a bit close to the craziness of Darlinghurst Road, but the convenience was great. Overall, we are very appreciative of the way everything was handled. We would give them five stars if our reservation hadn't been lost in the first place, but they made the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Carolinandrew
Reviews.Content: Excellent for my type of people. The rooms are spacious with beautiful infra. To fall in love with. Love to come back.

Reviews.Title: “your home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Patrick73
Reviews.Content: Spent 11 days at the Diamant during our honeymoon trip and fell in love with this trendy hotel. Not only are the rooms spacious and funky and the location ideal (right where it all happens, with great bars and restaurants on Victoria), it is the people working there who make the Diamant so special. Adrian and the rest of the staff were always super friendly and more than helpful and did everything to make our stay an outstanding one. The complimentary day passes for the Fitness First gym around the corner are another highlight. We are hoping to be back this fall to visit Sydney and enjoy the Diamant.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay no problems”
Reviews.Author: Here2Help20
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean and modern. Location was very central to kings cross. Staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great business hotel and fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: yanisaurus
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Diamant Sydney for 4 days with some colleagues from Europe. we all found the staff super friendly and the location perfect for entertainment and proximity to the CBD....would highly recommend - great value

Reviews.Title: “The extra mile”
Reviews.Author: UKHolidaywatch
Reviews.Content: We stayed on business at this hotel and I was immediately impressed by the friendly and efficient staff who booked us in quickly given we were in a rush. I was having problems with my international phone and the manager Adrian was super helpful, taking time to find me numbers and offering his help and these little personal details made the hotel experience really stand out. I'd definetly come back and stay on a personal trip and thumbs up to the hotel team there! I've also stayed at the Kirketon before which is one of the 8 hotels in this family and was nice as well. A good find.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location..all we needed!”
Reviews.Author: TEAM-GEE
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five nights after doing a lot of research through trip advisor...Diamant stacked up for us. The area that the Hotel is situated in could be classified as a bit "seedy" ..a typical Kings Cross connotation..however in our view Kings Cross is a minor factor in the big picture!.. if you are here for great restaurants, great walks, shopping, leisure then this is the place to stay. We did not enjoy the "rougher" area of kings cross ..but felt safe..and if you can see past all that then what you really get is a great lively buzzy atmosphere....and to be honest we were not at all bothered by the environment at all..we chose to stay here for it's vibrancy, and accessibility to great restaurants etc.. A taxi from the airport cost $40.00 and the Diamant is literally 200 metres from the train station so getting around Sydney was a breeze. A trip to Bondi Junction for shopping is a must...as is Bondi beach, Manly..etc Public transport is very good in Sydney and safe....a week transport pass is the cheapest way to get around if you intend to use the train, ferries etc a lot. The room was good...although could have been a little cleaner..(however as the decor and furniture is dark brown/black I understand it shows every mark! ) The Bathroom was compact and we found it a little claustrophobic but it was fully utilisable and the shower was good. ..The sound proofing from road noise/nightlife etc was pretty good..and air con worked well. It was a bonus to have opening windows also! The Bed was one of the best hotel beds we have ever stayed in ( and we are super fussy about this)..the linen was second to none and changed daily. The shampoo and conditioner were of the highest quality...I have never seen such a lovely product like this in a hotel before. The only minor gripe was that the rooms and corridors are dimly lit (I know it's the style they are after)....but the rooms were a bit dark at night if you wanted a good reading light you are out of luck... however we were ok with this. The Ipod docking station was excellent, the safe a standard size and storage was good. The fridge was small..but ok. The view was great considering the location...we got great Williams St views....spectacular at night! We felt safe in this hotel and believe it is the best of all the hotels in this area..we have stayed at a few and viewed many and the Diamant stacks up well against it's competitors! Unbeatable in this area! Front of house and concierge were good..Adrian was especially great to deal with! The other man was less friendly however the other staff were great. Our tips for restaurants/eateries..all located on Victoria St and very close to hotel Spice I am....the best Thai ever Malabar...very good Indian cuisine Wow Cow....frozen natural yoghurt....fabulous Messina....genuine and top quality Gelato.. Pizza...I think it was called Mad Pizza (or similar)...very good meals here. ..and many many more options for every budget. In the Potts point area we have a favourite breakfast cafe called Metrio...fabulous coffee, the best ever Mocha my husband has had and out of this world banana bread..it's also a great place to spot a few celebs on the weekend during brunch/lunch! All in all this hotel fitted the bill for us...With Sydney accommodation it can be a compromise between location and the need for atmosphere...the Diamant isn't in the Best location if you are after the central city area, however that area is dead at night and for us we walked to dinner every night, got a gelato at 10pm if we wished...all so close and handy....if we stayed in the CBD we would have not had such superb accessibility to our fave restaurants..it gave us the flexibility to pop out for dinner, go for a walk..then out for desser..,all with such ease...we think for a five days stay... Diamant was great and we would always stay here..so close to Darlinghurst and Potts Point..two upmarket ares....where we ventured for all our meals..and these areas are very classy.. There is also a Coles supermarket very nearby to the hotel with all you need snack wise, water, fruit.....there is also a little massage/reflexology place in the Supermarket entrance area..it's not at all flash but the staff are very good and it is very well priced. The gym that is aligned with Daimant is of high quality also! We also enjoyed many walks from our Hotel, down to the Botanical gardens and around the waters edge to the opera house..this is spectacular and the views etc are wonderful!.... In summary..we will be back if this place stays in a good price range...and continues to be well placed on tripadvisor....it's a great middle/upper range hotel with the basics we needed and in an unbeatable location for us. Thanks Diamant!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: inaroundroom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice at the Diamont for two & four days respectively. The rooms are great with a big tv, comfy bed and are quiet considering the location of the hotel. The staff are friendly and accommodating had some post dispatched to the hotel prior to our arrival. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs and Smoke!”
Reviews.Author: lainey2332
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights at the Diamont Hotel and it was three nights too many. The rooms were nice enough and we were able to get in early. The first night, though, I was awoken to the smell of cigarette smoke filling my room. The second day, there were two giant bugs in our room, one a moth and one bigger & scarier than the moth. The receptionist came up to check it out with some Raid; he didn't see it and did not think it was a big deal. He did leave us the raid. Then as night came the bugs continued to fly over our heads as the smell of smoke slowly returned to our room. I called down again and asked if this was a smoking floor, the receptionist informed me the whole building was smoke free. Finally, between the bugs and the smoke we asked to be moved. Once we moved to our new room, we were instantly met with the bad smell of smoke again and the sound of people partying until 5 am. If you don't mind smoke and are there to party all night and not sleep then this is the hotel for you. Otherwise, I would avoid this place!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: conkerz
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Sydney at around 6am on a Sunday morning and it suddenly dawned on us that the room was unlikely to be ready, we made our way to the hotel on the off chance. When we arrived it was clear they'd had a very hectic night and they were full to brimming however the guy on reception realised we'd travelled a long way and were in need of attention! He took us up to a shower room, gave us towels and shower gel so we could freshen up and even gave us an adapter so I could dry my hair! They held on to our luggage and sent us off down the road to grab some breakfast at the Bondi Cafe (which I have to add is a great place to eat and drink with a very warm reception!) They called us to tell us our room was ready, sooner than we expected so we headed back. The room was very much as described and shown on the website, not really boutique in the true sense of the word but it's modern, clean, bright and very spacious! The bathroom was clean with all the bits and pieces you'd expect with great shampoo and conditioner!! Odd to comment on that but it was THAT GOOD! The area does have a wide range of entertainment but it's not in your face and there are good bars and eateries around (I loved pie face), it felt safe, the train station was a stone's throw away, there's great jogging with lots of hills and steps if you're so inclined and the street the hotel is on is very quiet. All in all we'd stay again and we thank the staff for a great service

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Toptravels
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be just as described on their website. We stayed there from the 21st to 24th September 2009. The staff were really helpful, even loaned us an unberella when it was raining!!! The concierge was fantastic and helped us with everything from confirming a dinner reservation to toll charge payments online!!! We booked a deluxe room and had an excellent television , tea making facilities and wetroom/bathroom. We were lucky enough to have a good view of the harbour bridge, but this was more out of luck than being requested. They also have access to a Fitness First Gym around the corner of the hotel, which was really good. There is also free access to the internet from the computer on the front desk at reception. The only thing is that you have to stand at the reception to use it. If you want to take it to your room I believe there is a charge for that. The only things I would say worth noting is that it is a good 20 minutes walk into the town centre. On the plus side you are very near the Kings Cross train station which can take you to the Harbour Quay (you need to change trains to do this). As for the area, it is known as a red light district, with bars/clubs catering for both gay and straight people. Having said this, the hotel is not on a street that this nightlife is particulary evident. The main excitement and diversity is on Darlinghurst road which is perpendicular to Kings Cross Road. I would say that the area is not nearly as bad as some people had made out to me before I went! Yes if you are looking for "seedy adventures" you will find them! But if you are just out for a few drinks in the area and to capture the atmosphere then you will have a good time. Definately worth booking this hotel and would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with friendly and professional service”
Reviews.Author: langdonhiott
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Diamant for 2 weeks in Sydney and I have to say that it is the best accommodation I have stayed in Australia. The value was exceptional and the level of service and friendliness is not something I have come across often. I highly recommend anyone to stay here. It was a fantastic stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with no complaints”
Reviews.Author: Traveller-English
Reviews.Content: We found the staff at the Diamant polite and helpful throughout our stay. Our deluxe room was nice enough but I would not have said the hotel was a luxury hotel as described on the website. The bedding was clean and the room had the usual hotel amenities ie fridge, kettle, flat screen tv. This is a modern/contemporary hotel with good fixtures and fittings but the lack of other facilities ie gym, restaurant & room service etc, if thats what your looking for mean its not really a 4* but more of a 3.5*. The location of the hotel is around a 20 minute walk into the city. There are lots of bars, takeaways and a 24 hour offie located nearby so not the most sophisticated of areas, but interesting so again it depends what youâ€™re looking for. We had a peaceful stay on the 6th floor with no complaints and if you don't mind a short walk its a good place to base yourself. We would recommend the hotel as good value for money at around $160 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: tampagirl13
Reviews.Content: For the price that we paid for two nights I expected something a bit nicer. This hotel was clean and very modern, but about the same page of a Courtyard Marriot or a Doubletree. The bathroom I will admit was above par to the previous hotels mentioned. The carpet was a bit stained and could use a good steam cleaning (it is black carpet which is half the problem) and the light shades need replacing as well b/c 2 of the 3 in the room had cracks. Besides those two problems, the room was very clean. The corners of the bathroom were dust and hair free, mirror streakfree, and white sheets were crisp white. The hotel is in the "red light" district, but if you have been to NYC, SanFran, or anyother big city you won't come across anything you haven't seen before even in the nicer areas of NYC or SanFran. There are some amazing restaurants and cafes in the area and it is right near the subway terminal. The whole hotel is nonsmoking, and on one evening a room down the hall from us was smoking in their room. We notified the front desk immediately and they took care of the problem very swiftly. Over all if I could find a better rate than what I paid I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish, comfortable, friendly, perfectly located. THE best hotel in Sydney, hands down.”
Reviews.Author: LPayton
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVE this hotel! I travel worldwide for work, and the Diamant rivals (and in many ways exceeds) my other favorites (Mercer in NY, The London in LA). The front desk staff, especially Adrian (concierge), are wonderful, always remember me and go out of their way to make things as simple and pleasant as possible. Rooms are new, stylish (not cold), beds are wonderful and the shower is pumping with pressure. The supplied toiletries are great and the flat screen TV and free internet mean you're never out of touch. The hallways are beautifully lit and create a great atmosphere that feels NOTHING like sterile hotel corridors of the past. Normally, I would take points off for the lack of room service breakfast (there's a totally fine restaurant just off the lobby that serves breakfast), but with breakfast institutions like BILLS just around the block, there's plenty of incentive to head out in the morning. The Diamant really does feel like my home away from home when I'm in Sydney. Room rates are very competitive and the location is perfect. I HATE staying in the center of the city (sterile/touristy) - Potts Point/Darlinghurst/Paddington adjacent Diamant is right in the heart of some of the best restaurants, bars, cinemas and walking distance to anything you need in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Diamant.”
Reviews.Author: JenTaylor31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on our first trip to Australia. Asked for an early check in after our long flight and was happy to have our room ready when we checked in. Adrian, the concierge, is very helpful and knowledgeable about all things Sydney. Adrian arranged a massage for us later in the day at a new spa around the corner. Our room was small (by American standards) but clean, stylish and functional. Our bed was one of the best we had in Australia. My only complaint is the half glass wall in the bathroom. This is a new design trend in many hotels but I hate all the water that gets on the floor outside of the shower. There is a small mini bar fridge and tea set up. We love the pulse of the city and did not find the neighborhood scary at all. Yes, as in all cities you have to be careful, especially at night but as a single lady I did not feel threatened at all in the area. (It was like NYC...only nicer!) The hotel has an agreement with the gym around the corner and that is a nice perk. There is also a grocery store close by which is perfect for picking up water, juice, snacks, etc. There are some great restaurants and cafes close by. Hugos Bar Pizza, Tiger Bakery, Thai I Am, Bills. [Make sure you do Bill's for Brekky. YUM. Ricotta pancakes.] There is also a wonderful bakery next to the fire station but I can't remember the name. They make great almond croissants. Coffee cafes are too numerous to name. The train station is close by although we found the walking to be easy and fun. There are many tourist areas with lots of hotels in Sydney. I felt like the Diamant gave me more of the true city feel. In fact, we had reservations at another top rated hotel for our return to Sydney. We canceled and stayed once again at the Diamant as we were so comfortable there. I have to give all the staff kudos for service and being so nice. And yes, I am going to give another shout out to Adrian. He gave us some wonderful restaurant recommendations (Cafe Sydney) and always knew to steer us in the right directions whether is was an Aboriginal art gallery, stores, or shopping. He is a true asset to the hotel! So, if you like a true urban setting, clean hotel, great staff and everything you need close by then the Diamant is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel which near to crash our vacations”
Reviews.Author: polarbear70
Reviews.Content: Cannot say anything bad about rooms - it was clean enough. Location is not very good - as I cleared up later - it is located in Kings Cross - city district with concentrating of prostitution, drug selling and huge amount of derros. If you rent a room in this district be ready to hear screams at night, continuous hassles directly under your windows, huge amount of criminal. We saw all this things. Our check in was nice, nothing was threaten. We got "surprise" from this hotel later, when we already leave Sydney to another part of Australia. When I tried to pay by credit card in hotel during check out (I cannot mind to check my ballance before because I was sure that everything is ok) - it was 4 in the morning. And the receptionist told me that my credit card doesnt working. It was a great surprise - because our plane take off in 2 hours. We had to find 24 hours ATM to drop money from another card to pay for hotel. Now I know the reason. Diamant hotel Sydney have charged my card for 4 nights stay, and they also freezed another 1200 AUD, WITHOUT ANY NOTICE. This amount became unfreezed only after 14 days. Every of hotels, I stayed during this trip noticed me before freezing, and the amount was not more then 100 dollars. But Diamant hotel surprised me very much.

Reviews.Title: “A nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: SandS09
Reviews.Content: We had a very pleasant stay in this boutique hotel. Very clean and spacious room with friendly and helpful staff. The location at Potts Point, is really Kings Cross and is not the nicest part of Sydney for a stay, but it is certainly colourful and full of action. Our room was quiet but we did hear a bit of noise from people leaving clubs late at night. I suspect rooms at the front of the hotel would be very noisy as they back onto the road.

Reviews.Title: “a gem location”
Reviews.Author: tpgrand
Reviews.Content: My partner and I choose this hotel for our first trip to Sydney. We stayed at this hotel for 5 days and at first my girlfriend and I wished we stayed closer to the attractions such as Darling Harbour and the Rocks. However, we were happy with our stay at this hotel. We arrived very early and there were no rooms ready as the hotel was booked full the prevous night, that was a hassle as we had touched down after a 9 hr flight and wanted to shower and relax. However, the helpful staff directed us to several cafes and we were able to walk and explore Kings Cross and the surrounding areas such as Paddington which boasts several trendy shops and boutiques. The area also has several lovely cafes to which we frequented each morning for breakfast. However some may be turned off by certain dodgy establishments in the area. The King's Cross train station is a 2 minute walk from the hotel and a train to Town Hall station is less than 10 minutes. To get to Circular QUAY you will need to transfer to another train and take a few more stops. As for the rooms, I would say overall the other reviewers have described the rooms adequately. We did not experience a furniture problem and every thing in our room was clean and new. Our room was closer to the elevator and the door is not thick and so we would occasionally hear other patrons of the hotel, which wasnt a big problem. Also, the hotel is close to a hospital and so at night we would hear the ambulances coming in. Beyond that, the room provided excellent amenities. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and I certainly would choose this hotel again. Some travellers may be turned off due to it s location but my girlfriend and I loved the area (despite the seedines at night) and we loved making the long walk down William St. to go explore the city. I would suggest this hotel for travellers who would like to explore the main attractions of Sydney and also get a taste of the trendy local neighborhoods that the city has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Bad service, Great rooms and location, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Lignocaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because my wife had some business activities within the hotel. The receptionist when I arrived in the afternoon was very short and did not offer a smile or address me by my name, this gave me a poor first impression. $200 for the night including breakfast in a deluxe room is great value. The 42" flat screen is a highlight, however the rooms are not well maintained with damage to some lamp shades and the table. I understand this is being seen to. The hotel information booklet had bent and damaged pages. Breakfast in the morning was OK for the price. The coffee was terrible, and my poached eggs had some rawness in the middle. There was no option of normal cereal on the menu which is a minimum in a hotel restaurant. Lucky the quality of the ingredients were of a high level. It is unlikely that we would return unless a few things are improved.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful new rooms but noisy on a Saturday night”
Reviews.Author: Charliego
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night - and got a room that was on a lower level facing south and it was hard to sleep for traffic noise and partying. Otherwise the rooms are new and very nice. I would have liked a bath, maybe the other rooms have one. Make sure you book parking in advance.

Reviews.Title: “just OK”
Reviews.Author: Ddc123
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I decided to stay at the Diamant...the Hotel was ok but nothing special...my room was definately in need of an updating....from the broken toilet seat to the ripped lamp shade and stained chair pillows. They staff was friendly and very helpful and the location was good..next to kings cross station and within walking distance to many restaurants and great nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Sleek”
Reviews.Author: undome
Reviews.Content: Me and sister arrived exhausted from Tokyo to the hot Sydney in late January. Hotel was easy to find, even for us Sydney-virgins. It's conveniently situated close to Kings Cross station, which also means that you are near all the hype of the area. Reception was more than nice, everyone was really helpful. Hotel itself was very clean, modern and even pleasing to the eye. Our room had a comfortable bed, a huge flat screen TV and a really cool bathroom. Only thing that didn't really work was the wireless internet (now that I've been in Australia longer, I understand that some things are not like at home in Europe). Otherwise, good stay. One final thought: if in need for a great breakfast, walk Victoria St towards Oxford St until you reach a park on the left. There in the corner of Liverpool & Victoria is a great little cafe that does the best coffee, OJ and mushrooms on toast.

Reviews.Title: “groovy hotel - fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: flighty77
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently and was extremely impressed. Rather than stay at a huge expensive hotel my boyfriend and decided took the advice of a friend and tried The Diamant - we were not disapointed. Fantastic rooms, lovely service and a great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff and very good rooms, but not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: AMANewJersey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a tourist. The hotel is not in the exact middle of the city, but a location that is near public transportation and within walking distance of some tourist sites. The staff was VERY helpful with suggestions about where to go and how to get there. Rooms were clean and well-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem....”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneDarren
Reviews.Content: This is a great little find! Good value and good room sizes with bit of style as well. For boutique market (and prices) this is very solid option. Didnt spend a lot of time at the hotel but when i did it was relaxing in the room. In addition the gym access via fitness first was also an attraction. i dont usually put posts on sites but the service was really beyond expectations so thought it was worth the time to do this!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: joel76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights after an 8 week trip around Australia. It was one of the nicest hotels we stayed in. When we checked in they advised us that they had upgraded us to a room with a balcony (bigger than my dinning room at home and with very comfortable wicker arm chairs). They explained this was because we had requested a smoking room and they did not have any. What a nice change not to be treated as a social outcast. The room was very modern, great TV and very comfortable bed. good mini bar selction too. Location is ok right under the coca cola sign in Kings cross and it was a nice change from the other areas of sydney we had stopped in. Was a bit more of a pain to get to tourist centre though. Great bar across the road with live music. The only complaint about the hotel was that the walls seemed very thin, we could hear everything and I do mean everything that was happening in the room next door. I would definitely stay here again as service was attentive and you got more for your money staying in Kings Cross.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kelbywelby
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights and were impressed. The Diamant's location is very good and it is an excellent base from which to explore many of Sydney's highlights (and darker recesses!) on foot. On those occasions when a taxi was necessary, it was never very expensive because of the hotel's central location. There are many cool bars, cafes and restaurants within a stone's throw of the hotel and the concierge (see more below) was more than happy to recommend local favourites. Our room was newly decorated, with large and comfortable twin beds. The room was decorated in a modern, relaxed style and was large enough for two of us, with a reasonable amount of luggage each, to be comfy. The bathroom was clean and new and included great products - of a higher standard than one would expect in most hotels. Our room was quiet, even though it had large, openable window offering a city view. Our one (small) criticism of the room was that the fixing of the TV to the wall was slightly dodgy, though this was a minor cosmetic issue that did not in any way impact on our stay. By far the best feature of the hotel for us was Adrian, the friendly and efficient concierge. He organised a couple of dinners for us, including one for a largish group of our friends. He worked hard to get us good tables in popular places and was very patient even when we mucked him around by changing our plans. He called us during the day to let us know how he was getting on with our reservations for that evening. And, when I ran into him on the street on his day off he was very friendly and asked how the bookings he had organised for us had worked out. All in all, a true star. We had a great time in Sydney and the Diamant only added to our enjoyment of our stay. I'd really recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooked so was shipped off to another hotel”
Reviews.Author: OzEnigma
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to trying the Diamant, but when I got there, I was told the place was overbooked and had been moved to the Quest hotel. Being a single female that was meeting friends in Darlinghurst, I was not prepared to stay on that side of the red light district, so they found me a room at the Kirketon (horrible hotel I found out). There was only one staff member on duty and she was lovely and very helpful, but she was completely swamped with customers queuing for her help. They really need to increase staffing. The lobby design is great and I really wish I got to try the rooms. I was sent a bottle of wine and nice note in the morning at the Kirketon, which was a nice touch, but it was absolutely unacceptable to have been moved in the first place. Don't trust that you will get a room there if you book there.

Reviews.Title: “In a perfect world, all hotels would be like this”
Reviews.Author: Steve147
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days over new year, turned up here at 7:30am straight from the airport. Not only were they able to check us in there and then, but our room was ready. But not the room we had booked, we had been upgraded! The lesson to learn here is that it's definitely worth emailing ahead (as we did) as the hotel will do all they can to accomodate you. Room was really plush, with a king size bed, massive TV at the end of the bed, writing desk, plenty of wardrobe space, balcony, walk-in double shower, in-room safe, etc. Only niggle here (actually, the only niggle with the entire stay) is whoever decided it would be a good idea to put the safe right on the floor in the darkest corner of the room needs to have a word with themselves - it's no fun being on your hands and knees trying to feel your way around what's in the safe, a bit more thought should have gone into this. The hotel's location is spot-on, really close to Kings Cross station, we had both been to Syndey a few times before so knew what to expect here. Other than my little gripe about the safe, I've not got a bad word to say about this place. I've given "value" five stars, but in truth I'm unable to give a proper rating as, in Sydney at new year, there's no such thing as a "normal" price (though the Diamant was better than many we looked at). But it's not fair to mark them down on this, the next time I'm back in Sydney I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: awsculli
Reviews.Content: We selected the Diamant Hotel on the back of it's reviews, and the value it appeared to offer rather than its location. We were very pleasantly surprised. The hotel appeared to be newly refurbished, and the rooms were extremely well appointed and did offer a harbour view, albeit at something of a distance (we were on the 5th floor). No complaints whatsoever. The staff were welcoming and courteous, and we enjoyed a bit of friendly banter with a few of them. We had a car and paid for a space in the garage, but it may be worth reserving this before you arrive as spaces are at a premium and local parking could be difficult. We didn't use the restaurant, simply because we were out of the hotel on our travels and preferred to eat out. The Diamant is just on the outskirts (100 or so metres from the main action) of King's Cross, so be prepared for what goes on in the area. It goes with the territory! When we walked to the train station during the day we encountered some interesting characters, so we preferred to take cabs in the evening. Having said that this is all part of what makes Sydney the city it is, so we cannot be critical. We knew where it was and would not hesitate to stay again or recommend it, provided you understand what Kings Cross represents. Our room was quiet and we got four good night's sleep. Adrian was most helpful with bookings for the restaurants we ate in (Woolamooloo and the Sydney Tower) and helped with ideas on trips and sightseeing. Another good thing: we booked well in advance, got a good rate as a result but were not expected to pay in advance as we did with many other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great looking hotel - friendliest and helpful staff ever met, cery modern.”
Reviews.Author: IT_Dude666
Reviews.Content: Needed a place to stay close to the office for a few days - a friend recommended the Diamant. Never heard of it before but absolutely loved it. It has a great location and wonderful views. Looks like it is a new hotel, the fittings and design is very modern and exquisite. The rooms were very spacious with a very comfortable King Size Bed and a desk along the window great for work. The views out the window were nice, could see the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and until this morning Fort Denison in the Harbour. This was from a room on Floor 6. The wall mounted 42" LCD tv just topped off the room. Nice 2 person shower and large bathroom, I hate others were you are cramped. Overall I would definitely recommend the Diamant and will stay there again. I saw they have one in Canberra so i will have to try that one next time I stay there.

Reviews.Title: “In need of TLC”
Reviews.Author: landcruiserBJ
Reviews.Content: Having decided to take a February break in Australia the search for accommodation began. The write ups and website for the Diamant looked promising as did their â€œstay long and saveâ€� offer of stay a minimum of 3 nights and save up to 30% - we decided to book their premier room, The Courtyard Suite, for our first 4 nights. On entering our requirements through the â€œstay long and saveâ€� link we achieved a 2.8% discount of $32 on an $1152 charge. Out of curiosity we input various other dates, various lengths of stay and various standards of room and never managed a â€œstay long and saveâ€� discount exceeding 8.3% - so donâ€™t be fooled by the offer of up to 30%, it probably only applies when your stay includes 30th February!! The online booking process was quick and simple and the welcome at the hotel was pleasant and professional. We arrived early, at about 10.00 oâ€™clock, intending to store our baggage pending check-in, we were offered and gratefully accepted immediate check-in. The room facilities met all of the promised facilities i.e. 2 x 42inch plasma TVâ€™s (one in the lounge and one in the bedroom), DVD/CD player, bedside clock radio, bedside radio/iPod dock, extremely comfortable bed, good sized room safe, en-suite shower room with twin sinks and toilet, a good sized â€œguestâ€� toilet off the dressing room area, ample wardrobe and drawer space, a well stocked mini bar that was emptied on our request so that we could use it as our own fridge and a city view balcony that was absolutely huge. On the downside the kindest I could be is to say that it was a â€œlittle tiredâ€�, more realistically I would have to say it has been neglected. Soft furnishings were in need of some â€œhousekeepingâ€� attention. Curtains were in need of a clean, an iron and a re-hang. The sofa and armchair needed a good clean and polish. The carpet was badly stained in a number of areas and â€“ despite a complaint â€“ did not even benefit from a vacuuming let alone a shampooing. The mismatch of balcony furniture was a disgrace with both the wicker sofa and the mismatched stool being broken and unusable (a complaint resulted in two inappropriate chairs being supplied). The full-length window from the lounge to the balcony had a long crack in it. The attached â€œPenny Laneâ€� restaurant is acceptable without being remarkable. The hotel is situated on the edge of the â€œcolourfulâ€� Kings Cross area and there is a plentiful assortmant of eating and drinking establishments a short walk away â€“ we did not find the area at all threatening. In summary, the special offers do not seem to exist, the overall pricing seems to reflect the location and could be seen as good value if a bit more house keeping attention was paid to the establishment â€“ as it was, we felt very disappointed with our experience and would not return to the Diamant Hotel, Sydney

Reviews.Title: “sparkly shiny hotel for flash people”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diamant for 1 night when on business. I paid a decent rate but it is at the upper end of the market for what you get. I had one of the courtyard rooms - and i am not entirely sure why they exist. They look directly opposite into the apartment block across the road and I was in the last room so to the left I looked immediately into a young woman's apartment lounge room - a few metres away. Bet she LOVES that ! (not). Looking right - there are no vision barriers so looking straight at other rooms and eventually sydney in the distance. the room is the same size and facilities as any other hotel room. Just more modern colours, minimalist design, a bit more shiny and blingy. The toiletries, towels, sheets, pillows etc all the same as everywhere else. but hey - a sleek black leather bedhead. Did not take anything from the minibar - but did order room service from the restuarant downstairs which was good quality, expensive and large portions. Car parking was a rip off - $35 overnight - only 12 hours - and very limited - book early to make sure you get a spot. and I hate sydney carparks - they take any space, and size and jam too many cars in. I had to to do 27 point turns to avoid other cars, pillars, cleaning carts, stairwells etc. But it can be risky to leave your car on the street in this area. I am not entirely sure why you would stay here. If you want the Cross there are cheaper places, and it costs more than city central hotels.it is very modern, clean, comfortable, nicely done.

Reviews.Title: “Seen better days”
Reviews.Author: DrSmith35
Reviews.Content: The Diamant has seen better days. The room was shabby, the walls scuffed, some of the finishes were bubbling and the bedhead was covered in dirty handprints. The towels were the meanest, thinnest towels I have ever encountered in a hotel. On the upside, the bed was very comfortable and the bathroom above average. The location is also excellent and, despite the location the room was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but lacks a few details”
Reviews.Author: LondonDj
Reviews.Content: Just got back from staying here for 6 nights. Arrived around 12 but the receptionist called housekeeping and found us a room that was ready - after such a long flight, we were really glad to get straight into the room. The bed was comfortable and big and we slept very well every night. Even though the hotel is in the thick of things, noise was not a problem. The room looked like it had seen slightly better days. A plug socket was hanging off, the wardrobe door didn't open and the cupboard door didn't close. All minor things that did not affect our stay. The mini bar was cleared within 10 minutes of us asking reception - handy to put your own stuff in. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The bathroom was a bit small and dark - but the large shower was nice. Not sure what was going on with the toiletries - we ended up getting 8 bottles of stuff only 2 of which we we used and these 2 were never refilled. All a bit odd. Location: great if you want to go out for meals and drinks - loads around the area. If you plan to spend your time on ferries, opera house etc, it's a bit of a walk (although taxis to the ferries/opera house etc were only AUS$10). We didn't have any problems with the area being "seedy" - it's only like that in a very small area which we didn't walk through. Overall - good stay. If the place wants to be a true "boutique" I reckon they need pay a bit more attention to the details.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: garmic57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Diamant in early February 2009. The hotel has 11 floors. On the 2nd floor there is a string of ill-named â€œcourtyard roomsâ€� equipped with large terraces of about 4 by 6 meters, overlooking Kingâ€™s Cross Street. Iâ€™m not sure itâ€™s an interesting option, except maybe if you are a smoker: The view is far from scenic, and donâ€™t expect any intimacy since just opposite thereâ€™s a 40-or-so-floor apartment building looking down on you (see pictures). Itâ€™s also a bit noisy with the windows open, but when they were closed I heard nothing. I guess the rooms on the other side are quieter but I didnâ€™t check it out. I booked the room through the hotel website and paid 1,470 AUD for 7 nights. Internet in the rooms (Wi-Fi or cable) comes at 7 $/hour, 20$/day or 35 $/full stay. Itâ€™s fast but it didnâ€™t work well during the last 3 days. The room was large, spotless and very comfortable. The staff are courteous and friendly. Special thanks to Alex, Tim and Daniel who responded to all my requests - some of them being a little extravagant - with much friendliness and efficiency. The location is excellent, and one thing that hasnâ€™t been mentioned yet is that within walking distance on William St. there are located at least ten car rentals. (I opted for Europcar because they offer a zero-dollar damage liability.) On the down side: Late check out after 1 pm isnâ€™t possible unless you pay a whole extra night. I know hotels that charge 10 â‚¬ an hour (Altera Pars, Cologne), or about a half day (Furama, Singapore). So hereâ€™s room for a bit more flexibility. I was able to take a (cold) shower before going to the airport. The bedside lamp, like so often in hotels, doesnâ€™t give enough light for reading. The minibar is equipped with a system that bills immediately every bottle that is removed. I hate that because first, itâ€™s shouting â€œWe donâ€™t trust youâ€� right into your face, and second, every time you want to put a personal item in the fridge you have to tell the staff that you didnâ€™t actually have the drink that has just been put on your bill. However this was not a problem at all, they very promptly removed all the items from my bill. All these are very minor inconveniences; altogether the Diamant is a very good hotel. I enjoyed my stay and I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe The Hype”
Reviews.Author: geakey1
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for a special last night to a 5 week trip to Australia, believing it had that 'wow' factor, and would be a treat for my girlfriend. I booked what I believed was the best room in the hotel, (The Courtyard Suite), for about $285.00. We arrived a couple of hours early to be told my a nice polite chap on reception that the room was not ready, no complaints there. The hotel is located about a 10 minute taxi from the CBD but has a number of bars and cafe's locally. We grabbed some lunch and returned at 3pm expecting to check in at the advertised time. We had to meet friends for and as such didn't have much time, and at 3.50pm the room was STILL not ready. I find this incredible considering the receptionist had said that housekeeping had started at 11.30am!!?? Having finally got our room key, I went in thinking well at least the room will be lovely... wrong. At first glance I noticed the very large crack in the window facing the courtyard which looked awefull when coupled with the dirty and fingermarked glass. It was then I noticed the marked leather furniture and brown stained carpet. We turned on the lights to find most of the light shades' broken and further dirty marks on the walls. The towell rail in the wet room was hanging off the wall and the shelf by the shower much the same, (a particular worry as this was glass). The only accessible sockets were located in the bathrooms, but due to a poorly designed wet area this meant that following a shower, my girlfriend was standing in a puddle of water while plugging in the hair dryer!! It doesn't take a genius to work out this is not a good idea. To add to the list the glass coffee table in the lounge was badly chipped, and a curtain was broken!!! The courtyard itself was huge and could be lovely if it weren't for the tired wicker furniture. There were no cusions and the sofa had exposed springs. The view however to the CBD was lovely, and the room has 2 large LCD TV's (however only the one in the bedroom worked). Despite the tone of this review, I really am quite easily pleased. I just can't stand it when hotels neglect to perform basic maintenence. I mean how much would it cost to replace the carpet, lamps, and get a handyman to fix the shelves?? We stayed in a $50 motel in Townsville that put this place to shame. The only good points are the size of the room and a very comfy bed. If I had had more time when I arrived I would have asked for another room. I don't know what the other rooms are like but I wouldn't recommend staying in the courtyard suite. P.S The young guy on reception was very helpful, polite and apologetic.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: NLR
Reviews.Content: I did not know what to expect with the Diamant: It was in 'seedy' Kings Cross and seemed quite cheap for a major city hotel. I had nothing to be worried about. It was a great place to stay for a week. It is a very modern arty hotel with fashionable minimalist decor, a brilliant bathroom with a lovely shower. The bathroom condiments were wonderful - of a very high quality and the towels were fluffy. Wifi for a week cost us only $37 AUS. The hotel is 5 minutes from Kings Cross Station but the other direction is Victoria Street with really good cafes and restaurants. Buses go to Watsons Bay and other harbour beaches from nearby. A few downsides: the provision of tea/coffee/milk was incredibly erratic, the reception staff seemed to be hired for dress sense rather than ability and the parking lot was incredibly awkward. But overall really good, and I'm staying again in 4 weeks time

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Diamant”
Reviews.Author: PrettyPerfect
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay here. No surprises and just as the website describes. The hotel is located in Kings Cross - an area which is lively; some might say dodgy but I found it safe and easy to get to. The station is just around the corner; Potts Point easy to reach, Darlinghurst up the road and easy to walk into the CBD. Found a very competitive deal on hotels.com during the Christmas period. The deluxe room has nice modern decor; mod cons (flat screen tv and ipod docking station); walk in shower and lush toiletries. The king size bed was super comfortable and I slept like a log. There is a building being renovated behind but didn't hear any noise and I even had a partial view of the harbour bridge! I had arrived early after a long flight way before check-in time and the staff were v. accommodating and found me a room which was ready. The concierge gave me good directions on a short walk towards Woolloomooloo, and through the Botanical Gardens to the Opera House. Staff quite friendly and efficient overvall - one of the spot lights fell from the fittings but it was fixed after I reported it - and they answered all my queries. Top tip is to take the airport transfer on departure - it's cheaper than the train! Like some of the other travellers; I found a lot of good eateries nearby (ooh including Bill Grainger's cafe) and Coles supermarket is in the mini shopping centre just around the corner - so avoid all the small and expensive convenience stores!! So a great experience all round!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway for young singles!”
Reviews.Author: nraged79
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Diamant at 7am, after 48 hours of travel. I went to the reception desk and advised an extremely friendly young man that I was a little early for the 3pm check- in (2 1/2 week stay). He promptly looked to see if my room was available, but unfortunately, I had to wait until the room was cleaned about an hour later, very quick turn around and I appreciated that. The room had a very contemporary design and the balcony was roomy and comfortable. I read many reviews below complaining about the furniture, and I must agree it is on the cheaper end, but it was sufficient for my stay and well worth the room rate. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. I would say the hotel is more suited towards the younger crowd do to the many pubs and clubs around the hotel. Oxford street, for those interested is about a 10 minutes walk. There is a very nice spa across the street I discovered called Zen Day Spa, you should check that out. There is a laundry and dry cleaning service at the hotel, but it is quite expensive, I suggest going to one of the local laundromat's down the street, much cheaper. There are many places to eat near the hotel including the Penny's Lane inside the hotel itself. It is pricey, but the food is terrific. Another convenience is the close proximity to the King's cross train station. A week pass run's about $45 dollars and I got my money's worth. By train it takes 5 -10 minutes to arrive in darling harbor, very close to everything. If you choose to walk downtown it is no more than 20 minutes. Overall, I think this hotel rates very high in Sydney. You will not regret staying at this fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can not fault this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marieka
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely brilliant. I have stayed in many hotels in Sydney and I can not fault the Diamant. Rooms are huge with King Size beds, all amenities you need, spotless, sound proof... could not hear a sound from kings cross, amazing bathroom with Keven Murphy toiletries that they top up everyday. Honestly, it was brilliant and the front desk is so helpful. They booked restaurants for us, printed out maps for us, booked us taxis, they could not have been more accommodating. If you are looking for a chic hotel, in an ideal location... then this is the hotel to stay at!!! 5 star all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: R90
Reviews.Content: The Diamant is a great hotel. It is slick, the rooms are spacious and the beds are really comfy. You get a huge plasma TV to watch (although Aussie TV leaves a lot to be desired) and the toiletries are gorgeous. I stayed here for 2 weeks and loved the location in Sydney. Kings Cross is rowdy and a bit edgy, however walk in the opposite direction and you have the many funky restaurants and bars of Darlinghurst to enjoy. Everything is within walking distance (Circular Quay in around 25 mins away) and although you are not in the very city centre, this is wonderful place to stay if you want to get a real feel for Sydney. There is also a brilliant Fitness First gym right next to the hotel (the Diamant will give you a free pass) and a Coles supermarket for stalking up on provisions. If you book on wotif.com you can usually get a great rate and unlimited internet access thrown in.

Reviews.Title: “Diamants are forever”
Reviews.Author: KevinGen
Reviews.Content: I booked my room at the Diamant through the very helpful and friendly sales department of Eight Hotels. They offered me a Deluxe room that was very much to my liking. It was spacious and very stylish. I loved the classy interior design. The bathroom I think was spacey enough for everything you need to do and the shower was lovely. The tv was huge and the dvd player was a cool extra to have. The people at the reception were very nice and always smiling and ready to help you out. The people in housekeeping also were very friendly. The hotel is perfectly located at the Potts Point, Darlinghurst and Kings Cross triangle, which offered us plenty of places to grab dinner and to go out. I never felt unsafe at Kings Cross whatsoever. Actually I was happy being this close to the Cross because it made it possible to get something to eat 24/7. I shouldn't forget to mention the one thing that made me sleep like I haven't done in ages. The beds are just amazing! The mattresses are unbelievably soft and the sheets and pillows are very comfortable and warm. If only my suitcase would have been big enough, I would have taken it with me! To sum up: loved loved loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “A big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Amy1980
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on this website we went for it and booked 5 nights into the Diamant and only stayed for one! The service was poor, the rooms air conditioning did not work and after informing the receptionist we then had to wait for another room to be made available and that air con was not much better. The location is not great, if you are visiting Sydney for the first time then just pay a bit more and stay in the centre, the Diamante is not in a particulary nice part of the city. When we finally checked out after the first and only night the hotel ordered us a taxi and then promptly gave it to someone else rather than informing us it had arrived and we had to wait for another one - but that kind of service is the hotel all over. I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: AndyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: Brilliant hotel, clean comfortable rooms with good facilities. Close to all the amenities that one requires, and a three minute walk to Kings Cross station. I had no problem with the location in terms of safety. Most comfortable bed ever and friendly staff. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Funky design but service was poor”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaAndDavid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Diamant Hotel Sydney in early December for a weekend in Williams Street Boulevard suite. Our initial impression of the room was good. They have obviously put a lot of effort into interior design and the style was very much to our taste. We quickly realised, though, that the furnishings were obviously fairly cheap and were already looking very tired with stains and discolouring. The view of from the suite was great. It's no harbour view, but sitting on the outskirts of the city means the building has some terrific views of the CBD. Even though it sits on the outskirts of the city, it is one of the noisiest hotels we've ever stayed at. There musts be a fire station near by and unfortunately the constant whirl of sirens kept us awake. The hotel falls down its service. It was one of those experiences where you feel like you are actually working rather than relaxing - constantly following up staff for things that should go without saying. For example, we booked a romatic package which, amongst other things, included chocolates on arrival. However, between our booking the package (at a reasonable premium on the normal room rate) and our stay, management had apparently decided that they no longer like the idea of the chocolates and so we would get none. Our first night was filled with a rather bizarre series of exchanges between us and hotel staff who, after two hours, called the hotel owner at home to see if they can just give us the chocolates from the mini bar. Surely such a schemozzles shouldn't happen over some chocolates. The breakfast from their Penny's Lane restaurant was very poor - best you go elsewhere. There are plenty of choices in Potts Point. Also watch out for the in-room entertainment system which is very clumsy and the associated internet isn't useable. These is a nice hotel with gorgeous rooms that would benefit from a change of management.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Stay in Sydney.....”
Reviews.Author: geepford
Reviews.Content: The Diamant is a gem of a hotel - beautiful decor spacious, absolutely charming and incredibly helpful staff. It was a perfect place to rest our sleepy heads on our trip to Sydney. Loved the atmosphere of the hotel, and the attention to detail. Would stay here every night if I could afford it! Great location for beaches access to anywhere in town... and fantastic nightspots on the doorstep - just make sure to ask the staff for recommendations. Fantastic coffee shops across the way if you want to leave the hotel that is.....

Reviews.Title: “happy 39th”
Reviews.Author: geoff90
Reviews.Content: After I had a great experiance with the Diamant hotel in Canberra, I throught I might try the Sydney hotel. Once again this hotel gave me what we were looking for in a hotel. Their warm approach when we arrived made us feel happy to start a great 39th birthday. The room was state of the art and the bed was very comfortable. There are so many resturants, coffee shops and bars around the hotel, what a great position. We will be staying there on my wife's 40th.

Reviews.Title: “Like it enough to stay there again”
Reviews.Author: WorkLifeNotBalanced
Reviews.Content: I took a 2-week vacation in Australia with my husband, our 4-year old daughter, and my parents. We went to Cairns, Gold Coast, and Sydney, and in each place, we stayed at a hotel/apt receiving a 4 1/2 rating on TripAdvisor. Out of the three hotels/apt, Diamant is by far the cleanest, and the most convenient. The Coles supermarket is right downstairs around the block and you can get everything from there. The Kings Cross train station is less than 5 mins walk away. With the AUD 5.20 City Hopper ticket, you are covered for the whole day whether you want to see the Opera House, or cross the Bridge to North Sydney to get a really nice picture of the Opera House and the Bridge. I did get warned by my Aussie friends about Kings Cross being the not so safe red light district. But honestly, I felt perfectly safe walking around at night (past 10 pm). There are a lot of really cute and nice restaurants/bars a block away. Walking there reminded me of the Village in New York City. Ask the people at the hotelâ€™s front desk. They make very good recommendations. BUT, make sure to call to make a reservation. For the recommended ones, especially on weekends, you either have to make a reservation, or prepare to have dinner past 9 pm. In terms of the service of the hotel, nothing extraordinary but good enough to make our 3-night stay very comfortable. As for pricing, I would suggest to book through the hotelâ€™s own website. I checked around and compared prices when I booked ours. I got AUD 160 per night for District View Rooms (not sure about the difference but the rooms we got were very decent) directly from their website. Somehow the promotion was not too explicit on their homepage. I checked out a few options to get the AUD 160 price (the first price I saw for the same room was AUD 280 or something). Guess it wonâ€™t hurt if the hotel can make the promotions more visible and easier to find by viewers. Lastly, bear in mind that the hotel does not have roller beds. So if you want to have one more person in the room, that person would either have to fit into a crib, or sleep on the floor. Overall, would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Diamant Hotel - a great night”
Reviews.Author: rgg1877
Reviews.Content: Just came back from surprising my wife with a night at the Diamant Hotel in Kings Cross for our anniversary. We had a great time. The hotel stamps itself as a trendy departure from the other staid and conservative hotels in Sydney from the minute you are greeted at the front desk by two young guys who seem to be genuinely enjoying themselves. It carries on through the darkened passageways with their blue mood lighting, until you enter the room. These rooms are exquisitely fitted out with funk - custom designed furniture, Kevin Murphy shampoos, and the "What to do in Sydney" notes were better than we've found anywhere else. The Diamant Hotel is situated in the heart of the Cross, so lots of good restaurants for dinner and, for breakfast, we walked down to Darlinghurst. All in all, a really enjoyable experience - a great night out in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kateanddavid
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here when we came to Sydney and liked it so much that we rebooked for a further 2 nights later in our trip, travelling to and from the airport on the hotel shuttle. The hotel is modern; rooms are large, clean and well-appointed, and staff very helpful. We had one room on the front overlooking the very busy street and one at the rear facing a building site. We weren't disturbed by noise in either case. The hotel is close to the Darlinghurst road, which abounds in backpackers, cheap eating places and night life. We found it buzzing and not at all threatening. The edge of the city centre and the botanical gardens are about 15 minutes walk away and the Opera House about 30 minutes. Kings Cross subway station is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money.”
Reviews.Author: Dannyt986
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights as part of a RTW trip and were not at all disappointed. The rooms are well appointed and nicely decorated (even if a bit black on black) in classic contemporary style and still very fresh. Our (limited) interactions with reception were helpful and friendly. There are plenty of good eateries south on Victoria St and clubs and fast food north on the same, the hotel's Penny's Lane restaurant looks OK but a bit lacking in buzz. We were on the 5th floor and weekend noise was not a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Diamant”
Reviews.Author: cili_padi_nz
Reviews.Content: The Diamant is well located in Kings Cross, - the train station is just a block away and a well-stocked Coles supermarket is around the corner. A $5.20 day hopper train ticket allows all day transport on cityrail trains, - served us very well. The Diamant room rate also includes free access to a very well appointed Fitness First gym (also around the corner). The room has a pleasant minimalist decor and the king-sized bed is very comfortable. The lighting lets it down though, as the room is not well lit for reading. Air conditioning and volume on the plasma tv appeared to have a mind of their own, but these were minor issues. Bathroom is small, but well laid out. Amenities are good, - there is even an iPod dock. Staff is helpful and friendly. The hotel does not have much in the way of tourist literature, best to pick these up at the various tourist information sites around town. There are lots of eateries around the area, most of which looked pretty mediocre. However, we had one of our best meals in Sydney at Aperitif which is down Kellet Street, a mere 4-5 minutes walk from the hotel. Also a couple of minutes walk is a small cafe selling delicious hot churros with dipping chocolate, a perfect nightcap. We booked on Expedia and paid NZ$774 for 5 nights stay, which is fantastic value. I highly recommend the Diamant, and would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it! Great place”
Reviews.Author: jenwel
Reviews.Content: Booked a room through wotif.com and had an excellent rate. The hotel is very easy to reach nearby a lot of hip and happening areas like the oxfordstreet, victoriastreet (great restaurants), darlinghust etc etc. Very close to Metro Station KingsCross and bussstops. The entrance of the hotel is beautiful. Friendly and helpfull staff checked us in. Our room was very stylish with a comfortable kingsize bed and a nice bathroom with good shower. Every things is designed very well and not to too posh. Really nice. So: clean, new, luxurious, affordable, stylish and friendly. Such a good combination!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but overrated”
Reviews.Author: MrChile
Reviews.Content: The hotel is OK. The shower area is small. The staff is friendly. This was my first time in Sydney, and is the first time I felt dissapointed with a Trip Advisor top ten rated Hotel. If this is the 5th Hotel in Sydney, probably I'll not return to the city...

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: MrHankinson
Reviews.Content: Booked through Wotif and later found a cheaper deal on their own website for the same room! - not the best start but it all got better from there. Arrived for a 1 night business stay, mid week and was greeted by the friendly reception staff. Quite attentive and actually booked me in early as i had 2 meetings to attend to, happy about that. Room was tastefully appointed, large king sized deluxe room, plasma tv with all the necessities on there, internet tv, satellite, radio - the works. Nice shower area but they don't go overboard on the cosmetics, no bathrrom pack as such just a few shower gels/lotions. View of the harbour bridge was nice. All in all a good place to stay, breakfast at Pennys next door was good to. I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Service Can't be Beat”
Reviews.Author: makeatrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant 5 nights and were generally impressed with the hotel and rooms, but the service is what stands out. Always friendly people at the desk who were very helpful with all of our questions and needs. Considering at first we knew nothing about how to navigate through the City Rail to get to where we needed to go, we ended up being pros by the end of the trip thanks to their patience and help.They also gave great recommendations for restaurants in the area. Kings Cross is a busy place with lots of activity going on Friday and Saturday nights, but the noise never bothered us at all. It was convenient to be walking distance to a train station, market and all those restaurants. Breakfast was included in our package at the adjacent restaurant, Penny Lane. It never seemed to be crowded and we thought the food was great, both breakfast and dinner. Again, service was excellent. Our room was more than adequate, with minimalist decor. Bed was comfy, but the chair was a very modern style that was hard to get comfortable in. The bathroom was on the small side, but clean. The closet doors seemed to be in need of repair, which is strange considering the hotel is only a year old. All and all we were happy we stayed at Diamant and had a fanstastic time seeing the sights of Sydney and the Blue Mountains. We went with Dal Myles for the Blue Mountain day tour and thought we really got a fabulous day out. Couldn't have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Bit of glamour”
Reviews.Author: lizar20
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights at Aus $190 per night. The hotel is located just around the corner from the Kings Cross train station and the nightlife of Kings Cross - which may not be your cup of tea but is not dangerous. In the other direction is a range of great little restaurants and cafes. All within walking distance (15 mins) of the CBD. The hotel itself has a small but elegant lobby, extremely friendly and helpful staff, and trendy decor. The room was a good size, very nicely presented with a huge TV, huge shower and nice toiletries. Several of the rooms below mine had an outdoor terrace that I could see into, but only once did I see one used (well, heard, late on Sat night). Kettle and tea bags provided but no milk. Around the corner from the hotel is a supermarket that is open late. Felt very comfortable here, and a touch glamorous.

Reviews.Title: “A superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: herbGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in September, a superb hotel in a great location. The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble. I never ate in the hotel as the restaurunt always seemed empty so I cannot comment on the quality of food, but the hotel is surrounded by restaurants, so no problem there. Definately worth a visit, one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: inheritancespenders
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights. Room was large, clean and well equipped. Bed was huge and very comfortable. Bathroom was large with a walk in shower. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Resaurant food was wonderful, if a little expensive, compared to other local dining establishments, but well worth it. The Kings Cross area is a colourful area of Sydney, but we felt quite safe at night walking around. There is a fire station close to this hotel who use their sirens whatever time of day or night they are called out. Living in a rural area of the UK it took us a while to adapt to this, but we soon adjusted. The TV internet was not very user friendly, but the staff did warn us of this and happily took the charge off the bill when we found their advice was correct. The room had a well stocked mini bar. We had it cleared so that we were not tempted to use it. We used it as a fridge for our own wines etc. again the hotel were quite happy for us to do this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... so nice details.”
Reviews.Author: pommie01
Reviews.Content: I like this place. I stayed here for two nights on business after reading the good reviews on Tripadvisor. And I wasn't disappointed. The front desk service was polite, and the checkin process very efficient, and well thought through (compare and contrast to the nearby Annam Suites!!). Rooms are clearly new, and are excellent, the bed is huge and comfortable, bathroom is nicely set-up, with a big walk in shower. The TV is huge LCD and hi-def with a good selection. Decor is dark and classy. Location is excellent (but see minor quibbles below) Some nice touches here - that I really haven't seen elsewhere: - The IPod compatible (not just plug in) but fully controllable by remote. Most travellers will have an iPod - and it works well. - The toiletries are "fancy" by classy, and of a high quality. Not the usual hotel rubbish. MInor quibbles (and they are terribly minor): - Not really enough accessible power points for ironing. - A taxi driver told me that the area is not "Potts Point" but rather "Kings Cross" - and taxi drivers can get confused by this distinction.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful choice for experiencing the True Sydney”
Reviews.Author: SusanDallasTexas
Reviews.Content: From booking to check out, our stay at the Diamant was pleasant and flawless. I work for one of the world's largest airlines and free lance for a travel magazine, so it is with some perspective that I say the Diamant is a great choice if you wish to escape the more touristy lodging venues and experience the real Sydney. I booked our stay directly online at the last minute - 24 hours before arrival in Sydney. The Diamant staff was responsive online and very gracious to give us an early check in following our 6:30 am arrival. The Kings Cross neighborhood has an undeserved reputation for seediness. We found it to be vibrant, safe, and full of great restaurants, bars and shops within a short walk of the hotel - and I was traveling with my senior parents and 18 year old son. Bill's Restaurant was two block walk and great choice for breakfast. Russell's Crowe's Boomerang (house) was a stroll away on the waterfront. Recommend A Tavola (Italian) for dinner and Oxford street for shopping, both nearby. The vibe of the hotel is edgy, urban. Rooms are roomy and spotless with high tech features. My only gripe is that the bathrooms were a little dark and thus could benefit from lighted make up mirrors. Amenities and bedding high quality. Service was helpful, responsive and knowledgeable. The front desk personnel seemed genuinely interested that we enjoy our stay. All in all, if you want to experience the true Sydney, rather than the packaged Sydney, I wholeheartedly recommend the Diamant.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good all round”
Reviews.Author: jo_welly
