Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant for three nights, partly to celebrate my boyfriend's birthday, having read glowing reviews on here. My summary would be, it's nice, but not amazing. The service is good, low key, helpful and friendly. The food in the Penny Lane's restaurant was really really good and we got our moneys worth with a B&B deal! A few little things grated. The room wasn't spotlessly clean - the shower floor needed a scrub, and there was some random hair on the duvet and carpet. I did ask for someone to take a look at the bathroom so they did, and removed a bit of hair, but it really needed a proper clean, scrubbing the grout lines to get the grime out. It thinks its pretty stylish, but it falls a bit short with things like the bathroom fittings not matching. Its a bit glossier than normal hotel rooms, but its still just reasonably cheap fittings more tastefully done than most. There wasn't a hand towel rail which was a pain and it was just a shower, no bath (doesn't bother me, but might some people). Some people raved about the nice toiletries, but I have a feeling they fill nice bottles up with something close to washing up liquid, as I thought it was pretty nasty to use. The big TV was nice, and it was great having radio through the TV. It would have been nice if movies weren't $20 to watch though. Don't touch the Internet through TV facility - it is awful! The iPod dock was also a good touch. The bed was super comfy and big. All in all, there are a few little things they could do to make the experience nicer, but I've no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed 17 days- Nothing but a great stay and staff the whole while”
Reviews.Author: Melissa_Pete
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had moved to Sydney for a year to work and were looking for a hotel we could stay in short term until the we found a place to rent for the year. We stayed about 17 days altogether and we had nothing but good things to say about the staff, the rooms and the service! The service was exceptional in fact and now we always check to see the availability of the Eight Hotels chain whenever we travel throughout Australia on weekend getaways and such. We have since stayed at an EIght hotel in Melbourne and will continue to stay whenever possible in this chains hotels! For a boutique hotel our room was not only well furnished, which you might expect from a boutique hotel, but also surprisingly generously sized. As you can imagine, we were basically living in the hotel room for almost 3 weeks, so the extra living space was a real life saver. The room was well laid out, making great use of the space available. We didn't get a chance to eat at the restaurant below (Penny Lane I think), but we did have breakfast a number of times down the road at the other EIght Hotel nearby, The Altamont, which was good, with friendly staff and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference venue for a small group”
Reviews.Author: KT11
Reviews.Content: The Diamant is an excellent value-for-money venue for a small conference. Our conference was for 15 people over 2 days. We chose the Diamant for the following reasons: - Location (good access to city and airport) - More personal service - Fun/"something a bit different" from typical 4 to 4.5 star standard - Competitive cost. The following were outstanding during the conference: - Food (cafe-quality cold and hot food, excellent dinner at Peggy Sue's restaurant) - Service (on time at every break, excellent management attention) - Fast check in/check out - Rooms for all conference participants. Very comfortable beds, great flat screen TVs Things we would love to change: - More cold options for breakfast - there is no self service cereal/cold cuts option - No toilet facilities on the same floor as the conference room (you need to allow more time for breaks as a result) Diamant is an excellent alternative to the chains for a small conference

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome to Oz”
Reviews.Author: AudnAde
Reviews.Content: Spent the first 5 nights of our Oz trip at the Diamant, & couldn't have had a better start. Booked after reading reviews, & a bit unsure re location at first, but not a problem at all. Admittedly the nearby Darlinghurst Road is a bit tacky & seedy (the "red light" area), but the area around the hotel is reinventing itself, & is bright & lively, full of lovely bars & restaurants (especially liked The Lincoln on Bayswater Road). The hotel is new (opened Oct 2007), modern, clean & comfortable rooms, very friendly & helpful staff, and attached restaurant serves tasty breakfasts. Located about 20mins walk from the city, but only a few minutes walk to Kings Cross metro station, which gets you to most places in the city. We'd certainly stay at the Diamant again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location - great hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Garota05
Reviews.Content: This is a reasonably new hotel and it shows. The rooms are immaculate (although for Sydney they are a touch on the small side). The bathroom was lovely and the Kevin Smith bath products were just beautiful... As another reviewer mentioned, the hotel is located on a VERY busy city corner, and there is no where really to 'drop off' - we were lucky that someone literally just dropped us off on the side of the road quickly, otherwise we would have needed to drive around for a while to find someone to park. The only strange thing was the mini-bar - which is all electronic. When we check-out they had us consuming three or four things that we didn't. They didn't charge us for these items, but obviously the electronic sensors are a little touchy. The location of the hotel is great. I normally stay more in the city (CBD) or the Rocks so to stay around Kings Cross was a different experience. Hubby and I walked a decent walk to the beautiful restaurants on close-by Crown Street and enjoyed a lovely meal at the Bills restaurant on Crown Street. We stayed at this hotel the night before flying out overseas, and the hotel is a quick 15 min drive to the airport. We checked out around 8am and finding a taxi in mid-week peak out was a little difficult, so best to book something in advance as there is no cab-rank out the front of the hotel. Overall, this place is modern, funky, quiet and enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “They put the 'Serv' into Service”
Reviews.Author: warrad
Reviews.Content: It was a dark and stormy night (heard that somewhere before) when we arrived at our hotel, The Kirketon in Darlinghurst Road only to find that it was closed for renovations. Bugger! I thought, what to do? Searching through our confirmation sheet we found a telephone number and dialled with all fingers crossed. Out of the pouring rain came a Knight in shining armour. He did not carry a lance, but 2 huge umbrellas. "Follow me" he said with a great big smile. And this was our first introduction to Adrian from the Diamant Hotel. "Sorry about the mix-up" he said appologetically. Imagine our surprise when we walked into the Diamant Hotel. The cleanliness, the professionalism of the staff, the first class amenities soon had us grinning like a lotto winner. Over the next three days we found the standard never waivered. In fact I am happy to endorse the Diamant Boutique Hotel in Sydney as one of the finest we have stayed in. Of course we have stayed in many great hotels around the world but not all of them had the inbuilt charm of the Diamant. Well done Adrian and the staff. See you again, soon! Michael Warren and Pauline Vukelic

Reviews.Title: “Its like home away from home”
Reviews.Author: MarcLindsay
Reviews.Content: Just recently I traveled to Sydney on business and wanted a nice place to kick back and relax after meetings. Two things matter to me when booking a hotel.... 1. Internet connection (it must have one and must be fast) 2. Luxury, it must feel nice to stay in. Diamant Hotel meets these two standards and so much more. I stayed in the Deluxe Room and will stay there again. From the moment you walk in you can hear the in room entertainment as tunes of Michael Buble float around the room, nice touch and superb selection of music. It actually really suits the room. Oh did I mention that there is a 41 inch lcd screen right on the wall for extreme watching pleasure? The hotel menu is provided by the in building boutique coffee shop and let me tell you, the club sandwiches are TO DIE for. Also one thing I was impressed with was that the gym is actually a joint venture with Fitness First (major gym in Australia). So you can have full access to a REAL gym, not a half botched job that most hotels do at providing a gym. I had one every single night for my entire stay. I hope they dont remove those from the menu. Let me cut it short for you. If you want a hotel to stay at that is central to most things in Sydney, is a pleasure to stay at and will treat you well. Diamant Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “diamant is a gem !”
Reviews.Author: Angela061
Reviews.Content: DIAMANT HOTEL â€“SYDNEY It's the little luxuries that count, faultless service from the friendliest of staff, king size beds with the crispest of linens, the latest technology alongside the purest of natural breakfasts. The Diamant Hotel is a gem in the heart of trendy King's Cross, just a stroll away from great restaurants and the colourful vibe of this cosmopolitan area. Itâ€™s calm, cool atmosphere, minimal without being intimidating, has everything the discerning traveller needs for a stylish stay away . Hip and contemporary, we preferred the customised privacy of this small boutique hotel to the lavish grandeur of some of Sydney's more stately landmarks.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SydneyBrad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel via Wotif.com as it was great value and 5 star for a weekend away. The rooms are very quietm, modern, the bed very comfortable and the service very good. It is a great place to stay and is very well located to everything. The cake shop around the corner is open late if you want a quick snack!! The shower did leak but the advised they were looking to fix this issue soon. Apart from that small issue it is a greta place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabine123
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Diamant over NYE and really liked the hotel. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Staff at reception was always very kind and helpful when we asked about places to go, restaurants, etc. The rooms are great, very modern and stylish with large flat TV, DVD player and I-Pod docking station (loved that!) and a large very comfortable bed. It did not at all feel like staying at an office building. When we arrived the safe was not working, but that was fixed immediately. On NYE we had a bottle of spakling wine, flowers and a CD in the room which I found very nice. Also prices for things from the mini bar and internet were very moderate. Breakfast in the restaurant Penny Lane's was very good. First we were a little sceptical as there were not too many people in the restaurant, but we gave it a try and it was really good. They do not have too many things to choose from and you should not be in a rush as they prepare things freshly but everything we tried tasted really great and was prepared with best, fresh ingredients. If you look for a fast and cheap alternative for breakfast there is a Holiday Inn just around the corner where you can have the full brakfast buffet for less than AUD20. I did not like the location of the hotel too much, as I did not find the surrounding Kings Cross area too attractive....but a lot of interesting sites that you might want to visit are within walking distance and bus and train stops are also quite close. The hotel was really great and I would definatly go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Will be Returning”
Reviews.Author: Niiki
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a couple of nights and very pleased with this hotel. The rooms are very trendy and modern and the TV is huge. Check-in was efficient and friendly. Bed was really comfortable â€“ an absolute must when we travel on business. I think that this is really Kings Cross and not Potts Point as advertised by the hotel, however, in saying that the location is excellent. It is a 2 minute walk to Kings Cross station and our stop (Town Hall) was only 2 stops away. There is a myriad of places to eat within close proximity and there is a Coles (for overseas visitors, this is a large grocery store) open until midnight every night. OK, the notorious area of Kings Cross is also just a short walk away, however, the area has really cleaned up and this just adds to the colourful scenery of the place! Couple of minor bad points: - Very expensive food on the room service menu (even in hotel terms) and quite limited as to variety. For a non-meat gnocchi dish, I think the price was around $30. - The servicing of the room was not done until after 3pm one day which was a bit of a pain as we had left in the morning for meetings and had to endure housekeeping servicing the room while we were there. We usually stay in the financial district of Sydney while on business, however, the value for money was hard to pass up and this will be on our preferred hotel list from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcekola
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Diamant for 4 nights in November 2007. Overall it was a great experience and I would recommend it / stay there again. Everything is new and clean in the hotel although parts are still under construction. Can't beat the price for the luxury, we paid about $230 AUD per night. HIghlights: Location (we could walk to everything we wanted to see) Bed (king size, amazingly comfortable, loads of pillows, each night I slept sound, great duvet and sheets) Gym - you will just get passes to Fitness First which is in the building next to the Diamant, so much better than a usual hotel gym. Decor- everything is new, clean and pleasantly stylish Service - everyone was great & helpful, including bringing an entire first aid kit to the room within a minute or two after I cut myself shaving (even though i had only asked for a single bandaid, hahaha). Lowlights: Shower - the water pressure was nothing amazing and water had a tendency to leak out into the rest of the bathroom. Also, the toilettries are great but come in inconvenient bottles that seem to dispense either too much (shampoo) or too litte (conditioner). On the other hand, the bar soap has an amazing smell, I loved it. I didn't find the A/C unit very loud despite what a different reviewer said. A great experience overall and well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable value in expensive Sydney ... definitely not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: BrysonFan
Reviews.Content: Sydney is an expensive city, and the Diamant is a reasonable value for those who do not want to pay top dollar. Here's the skinny on the Diamant based on my recent stay: Overview: The Diamant is in an office building which has been converted into a hotel. It still looks like an office building ... except it has beds and showers installed in the rooms. The lobby looks more like a tiny waiting area than a usual hotel lobby. Concierge services are at the reception desk (no place to sit and no brochures on display). It is definitely not a 5* hotel, and not what I would call "boutique." Pros: Price is reasonable for Sydney. Service is very good, although at the time I stayed here the staff was new & still coming up to speed. I expect that will improve over time. Location in Potts Point is good -- train and buses nearby which can take you to all the sites in Sydney, convenience shop across the street, post office a few blocks away, places to get something eat nearby. You can walk into the heart of things from here if you want, although it's a long walk. Beds are comfortable. Linen and towels of good quality (not deluxe but good). Broadband available in the rooms for an extra cost; there's a long desk facing the window. Flat-panel TVs in the rooms as well. In-room safe. Cons: Rooms are small, esp. the bathroom which is really too small for 2 people. No bathtub, just a simple shower which leaks water onto the rest of the bathroom floor. Not much room to dry your hair or put your toiletries. Curtains in my room were crumpled looking. Not much in the way of facilities in the hotel: you can use a fitness place a block away, and there is a restaurant affiliated with the hotel on the street corner. Noisy A/C fan in my room. Also found the lighting in the rooms, hallways, and lobby a bit stark and weird ... not very inviting IMO and more office-like than "boutique". Looks like they were trying to be stylish using cheap furnishings. Summary: a reasonable choice if you're looking for a convenient location to sleep, for a reasonable price. Not a place you'll want to do much besides sleep at night. I would stay here again mainly b/c the better hotels in Sydney are extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Love Sydney - Love the Diamant”
Reviews.Author: Girls0nT0ur
Reviews.Content: We have just enjoyed a fantastic 7 night stay in this new hotel in Sydney - its chic, its cool and easily the best city hotel experience I can remember. The staff are friendly and very helpful - the location, on the very edge of the Kings Cross area is excellent and the hotel rocks enough to have hosted the Time Out Sydney launch party! It is a small hotel with an edgy mix of office and residential space which delivers high quality accommodation. The beds are so comfy and the standard of housekeeping is extremely high. I did consider writing a dreadful review to keep the hotel a secret but I'm a generous soul who likes to spread good news. Stary here and it'll spoil you for other hotels.

HotelInfo.Name: Diamant Hotel Sydney - by 8Hotels
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Kings Cross Road | Potts Point, Sydney, New South Wales, Australia
